July 21: YNOT Network, LP : Loyalfans.com Launches iOS App for Creators

Premium content sharing platform Loyalfans.com is thrilled to announce that the Loyalfans Creator App for iOS is available now. Content creators can manage their businesses and stay in touch with their most loyal fans directly from any iOS device.

Download the app in the App Store under "Loyalfans Creators."

The Loyalfans app makes it easy to post fresh new content, keep in touch with followers and subscribers, monitor site activity, and check income stats in real time.

"We are beyond excited about the Loyalfans Creator App, located front and center in the App Store," said Loyalfans' co-founder Eduard A. Braileanu. "Creators have the power to run their businesses from the palm of their hands with the app - and the possibilities for connection are endless."

Functionality includes video, audio, image, and locked messaging; post scheduling; and timeline and video store posting (with desktop-comparable options to allow for public viewing and/or limit access to followers or subscribers only). Creators can also check their balances live; adjust pricing settings; monitor subscriptions, rebills, and cancellations; and receive push notifications when a message is incoming - with more features coming soon!

"We hope that everyone is able to utilize the Loyalfans App to help take their creative capacity to the next level," Braileanu added. "Loyalfans is committed to providing the most cutting-edge tools imaginable, all in an empowering, model-centered environment that puts the needs of community first."

The Android version of the Loyalfans Creator App is coming soon.

On Loyalfans, artists and content creators can turn their inventiveness and influence into thriving businesses via the most advanced technology and innovative features available. The site's features and tools include customizable messaging, live streaming, video chat, audio recording and podcasting, video and photo sharing, and more.

Loyalfans prides itself on transparency, inclusivity, authenticity, and stability.

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Corey D. Silverstein Esq. Launches Adult. Law

Adult industry attorney Corey D. Silverstein today announced the launch of Adult. Law, describing it as a "groundbreaking new subscription service to legal resources for adult entertainers (that) offers 24/7 access to legal expertise with no retainer fee."

In his announcement, Silverstein said he launched Adult. Law "as a way to meet the needs of a rising population of small business owners and workers that need affordable access to qualified legal experts now more than ever."

"In the past few years, due to a variety of shifts in legislation, regulation, and technology, the adult entertainment industry has seen a massive evolution where tens of thousands of entertainers have gone into business for themselves and become masters of their own paths," Silverstein said. "I have learned that nearly every adult entertainer has substantial legal needs and questions that vary tremendously: from content production contracts and liability, to criminal defense, and even simple business setup and maintenance. Adult entertainers have long been looking for a cost-effective solution to the unique challenges they face when doing business, and I believe we have finally created it."

According to the announcement, the subscription service offers "24/7 access to comprehensive legal resources, expertise, and information specific to the adult entertainment industry, with no retainer fee and packages starting at under one hundred dollars per month." Subscribers to the service "gain unlimited access to a mobile legal library of videos, articles and blog posts filled with information created and curated specifically for adult entertainers, as well as deeply discounted rates on additional paralegal and litigation services, as needed."

Premium Adult. Law subscribers also receive "monthly individualized one-on-one legal consulting time with an experienced attorney from Silverstein Legal." Subscribers can upgrade, downgrade or cancel their subscription anytime, and "unlike most legal services, there's no hefty retainer to pay upfront," the announcement states.

"During the past 15 years I have had the privilege of working with and getting to know this truly special group of entrepreneurs, and it has been an incredibly rewarding experience fighting for freedom of expression alongside some of the most amazing people I've ever met," Silverstein said.

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Adult Site Broker Launches New Affiliate Program

Adult Site Broker has announced the launch of a new affiliate program, Adult Site Broker Cash, which pays affiliates for referring site buyers and sellers to the brokerage.

According to the launch announcement, the new affiliate program "pays referral fees of up to 20% for bringing them new sellers and buyers of websites and companies." Sending one to two sellers or buyers over a 6-month period results in being paid 10% out of Adult Site Broker's broker commission on closed deals, referring three to four yields a 15% payout and 5 or more brings a payout of 20% over.

"We decided to formalize our referral program into a full-fledged affiliate program," Adult Site Broker CEO Bruce Friedman said of the decision to launch the new affiliate program. "We're excited about giving our affiliates the chance to earn large amounts of money."

The launch of the Adult Site Broker Cash is the latest in a series of announcements from the brokerage, which began broadcasting a new podcast in mid-May and launched an upgraded website less than two weeks later.

According to the Adult Site Broker Cash signup page, the new program is seeking an affiliate manager to help operate the new program. Source: Company Website

April 16: YNOT Network, LP : Pornhub Partners with Pineapple Support for Self-Care 'Competition'

Pineapple Support is launching a "competition" with Pornhub to highlight the importance of self-care. The competition invites those in the adult industry to share their favorite self-care activities during the lockdowns caused by the COVID-19 outbreak across the world. Whose self-care tips, tricks and tactics will win?!

Pornhub will provide a $100 voucher which can be used to purchase merchandise from its online store to a random winner that will be selected on May 1st. The competition runs in conjunction with Pineapple Support's self-care month throughout April, during which the organization will raise awareness around how self-care practices can be beneficial to mental health and wellbeing.

"We're committed to our ongoing support of individual care and self-care, and we believe that a healthy community can only arise from when each individual member's mental health is being cared for first," said Vice President of Pornhub Corey Price. "Our global community is going through a crisis with the COVID-19 pandemic and we are working on making sure we can all take care of ourselves so that we can take care of each other. Let's take the time to stay home, self isolate, and take care of ourselves."

"We're working to raise morale by asking people to share how you practice self-care," said PIneapple Support Founder Leya Tanit. "Throughout the month of April we will also be sharing videos and blogs on self-care at home, including workouts, yoga, nutrition, breathing exercise and more. We would also like to encourage our followers to send in videos to help others to keep mentally and physically healthy during isolation/lockdown. Let's help each other feel a little less alone."

Pineapple Support was founded in 2018 by Tanit in response to losses in the adult industry from depression, addiction and other mental illnesses.

March 24: YNOT Network, LP: Segpay Celebrates 15 Years in Business

Online payment processor Segpay announced today that one April, it will reach a major milestone for the company - its 15th year in business. To mark the occasion, Segpay is launching a "year-long integrated marketing campaign to promote new payment processing options and enhanced merchant service offerings-all backed by unmatched customer service."

"Over the past 15 years Segpay has developed a stellar reputation, by focusing on paying and always putting its clients first," the company said in its announcement. "Today, Segpay is trusted by the biggest and best-known brands in the high-risk payment category. It offers state of the art payment processing services via a robust, full-featured platform that includes proprietary gateway technologies and a cutting-edge Fraud Mitigation System."

Headquartered in Deerfield Beach, Florida, Segpay's reach has expanded globally and the company now has offices and outposts around the world, including London, Dublin, Toronto and Manila.

"We listen and learn from our merchants and this feedback has been the key to our 15- years of success," said Segpay CEO Cathy Beardsley. "It's our goal to continue to be on the forefront of the ever-changing rules and regulations to ensure safe, secure and compliant payment processing for our merchants."

Segpay also has unveiled a commemorative logo to mark its 15th anniversary, developed by the company's long-time agency partner Creaxion. Segpay said the new branding will replace the company's traditional logo across all advertising platforms over the next year.

"The number 15 is centered in the new logo to symbolize strength and utilizes Segpay's unique 'arrow' icon to complete the 5 in the number," Segpay noted in its announcement. "The dark blue color in the Segpay brand identity conveys trust, transparency and stability.

January 10: YNOT Network, LP: FanCentro Launches #FCAid Campaign to Aid Australian Bushfire Disaster

FanCentro has announced the launch of a new initiative to bring assistance to those affected by the bushfires raging in Australia. The campaign, #FCAid, was "launched today by the FanCentro team, together with influencers to encourage fans to donate to this important cause," the company said in a release announcing the start of #FCAid.

Under the initiative, influencers who opt in to #FCAid will receive a special "SOS Australia" tab on their profile, FanCentro said in its announcement. When fans visit this tab, they're able to make a donation which is then sent to the Australia Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery Fund.

"It's been amazing to watch so many of our influencers launching independent, altruistic campaigns to raise money for those affected by the devastating fires in Australia," said Stan Fiskin, CEO of FanCentro. "After learning how difficult it was for our influencers to manage all the donations and requests for content they're receiving by themselves, we knew we needed to help."

Fiskin said that with #FCAid, "influencers can raise money for important causes like this using FanCentro's suite of social media influencer tools."

"I hope with this initiative, we can make a significant impact on Australia, its people and the wildlife that calls the area home," Fiskin added. "However, to do this, FanCentro needs your help to spread the word about how influencers and fans can raise funds to help these fire-ravaged areas."

#FCAid donations start at a minimum of $5.00. Fans who donate $10.00 or more will receive a special piece of bonus content from the influencer through whom they donate.

"By joining #FCAid, influencers have no receipts to track and will simply receive a list of fans who donated so they can send them bonus content," FanCentro said in its announcement.

June 22: YNOT Network, LP : Paxum Issues Statement on Wirecard Bank Rumors

PaxumMONTREAL - Payment processing service provider Paxum has issued a statement to its clients "in relation to the recent publicity regarding Wirecard accounting irregularities," stating that the company "is following the situation."

"We feel it is important to publicly address the Wirecard situation to avoid unnecessary speculation and apprehension from our clients." said Paxum CEO Octav Moise. "We would like to reassure our clients that Paxum, as a regulated financial entity, holds accounts with numerous banks and financial institutions worldwide. Should we ever feel that Wirecard or any other bank is not an appropriate processing partner, Paxum will utilize an alternative bank to process your payments, and we will provide you with that bank's EUR funding instructions. Your incoming funding and outgoing payments will continue arriving as usual and without any interruptions."

In its statement, Paxum added that the company has "always had strong risk mitigation policies in place, along with safeguards that ensure our clients' funds are secure."

"This is why we are not dependent on our banking partners' financial viability, and why Paxum has always weathered similar situations and continued to conduct business without interruption," the statement continued.

June 18: YNOT Network, LP : Trump Exec Order, New Bill in Senate Take Aim at Section 230

Section 230 in the crosshairsJust over two months ago, I posed the question: When the COVID-19 dust settles, what will become of Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act? As it turns out, we may be getting our first hints of the answer to that question while the dust from the pandemic is still clouding the air.

On May 28, President Donald Trump signed the "Executive Order on Preventing Online Censorship," days after having one of his tweets flagged as "potentially misleading" by Twitter.

More recently, U.S. Senator Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) introduced the "Limiting Section 230 Immunity to Good Samaritans Act," a bill intended to "empower Americans to sue Big Tech companies who act in bad faith by selectively censoring political speech and hiding content created by their competitors," according to its sponsors.

In seeking to curb the immunity afforded to operators of interactive web services with respect to expression published by third-party users of their platforms, both Trump and Hawley want to tie the grant of immunity to a promise of political neutrality.

In remarks he made upon signing the executive order, Trump asserted that a "small handful of powerful social media monopolies controls a vast portion of all public and private communications in the United States" and that to this point, thanks to Section 230, those monopolies have "had unchecked power to censor, restrict, edit, shape, hide, alter virtually any form of communication between private citizens and large public audiences."

"There's no precedent in American history for so small a number of corporations to control so large a sphere of human interaction," Trump continued.

Flirt4Free recently announced the addition of Money Network to their catalog of payout options for models based in the United States. Money Network has gained popularity in the gig economy in recent years for their easy-to-use pre-paid cards and intuitive money management app.

For Flirt models, one of the biggest benefits of this new payout type will be the instant payment feature. Through a simple request placed through Flirt4Free's internal account administration interface, performers can access up to 50 percent of their weekly commission simply by visiting an ATM. With their Money Network card, they'll also have immediate access to their funds for online and in-store purchases wherever debit and credit cards are accepted.

"With a lot of uncertainty in the world, we wanted to ensure our performers could access their hard-earned money at a moment's notice," said Miguel Arriaga, F4F's Broadcasting Manager. "We feel adding Money Network to our list of payment options adds a new level of convenience and security for those who cam with us."

US Flirts who intend to use Money Network will gain more than an instant-pay option. The pre-paid card company also offers a full suite of banking options to help gig workers stay on top of their finances.

urn:contentItem:60DH-MN91-JB4F-Y2JM-00000-00July 21, 2020: YNOT Network, LP : Loyalfans.com Launches iOS App for Creators2020-07-22T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 21, 2020: YNOT Network, LP : Loyalfans.com Launches iOS App for Creators

Premium content sharing platform Loyalfans.com is thrilled to announce that the Loyalfans Creator App for iOS is available now. Content creators can manage their businesses and stay in touch with their most loyal fans directly from any iOS device.

Download the app in the App Store under "Loyalfans Creators."

The Loyalfans app makes it easy to post fresh new content, keep in touch with followers and subscribers, monitor site activity, and check income stats in real time.

"We are beyond excited about the Loyalfans Creator App, located front and center in the App Store," said Loyalfans' co-founder Eduard A. Braileanu. "Creators have the power to run their businesses from the palm of their hands with the app - and the possibilities for connection are endless."

Functionality includes video, audio, image, and locked messaging; post scheduling; and timeline and video store posting (with desktop-comparable options to allow for public viewing and/or limit access to followers or subscribers only). Creators can also check their balances live; adjust pricing settings; monitor subscriptions, rebills, and cancellations; and receive push notifications when a message is incoming - with more features coming soon!

"We hope that everyone is able to utilize the Loyalfans App to help take their creative capacity to the next level," Braileanu added. "Loyalfans is committed to providing the most cutting-edge tools imaginable, all in an empowering, model-centered environment that puts the needs of community first."

The Android version of the Loyalfans Creator App is coming soon.

On Loyalfans, artists and content creators can turn their inventiveness and influence into thriving businesses via the most advanced technology and innovative features available. The site's features and tools include customizable messaging, live streaming, video chat, audio recording and podcasting, video and photo sharing, and more.

Loyalfans prides itself on transparency, inclusivity, authenticity, and stability. The platform offers up to 80% payouts with the ability to earn an additional 5% for referring creators and fans. Loyalfans offers safe, stable processing via wire transfer, Paxum, ACH, and SEPA occurring on-time twice per month. Artists and content creators have direct access to 24/7 site support, as well as direct access to site programmers and developers.

INDEX

SECTION 1 YNOT NETWORK, LP PROFILE

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 1 YNOT NETWORK, LP PROFILE

1.1 ACTIVITIES

YNOT Network, LP engages in the ownership and operation of a resource Web site for adult Webmasters on the Internet. It offers various services to the adult Webmaster, including daily news, articles, chat rooms, and traffic exchanges. The company was founded in 1996 and is based in Glendale, California with additional offices in Texas and Florida.

1.2 SUMMARY

Website: http://www.ynot.com

Industry: Software and Technology Services

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Corey D. Silverstein Esq. Launches Adult. Law

Adult industry attorney Corey D. Silverstein today announced the launch of Adult. Law, describing it as a "groundbreaking new subscription service to legal resources for adult entertainers (that) offers 24/7 access to legal expertise with no retainer fee."

In his announcement, Silverstein said he launched Adult. Law "as a way to meet the needs of a rising population of small business owners and workers that need affordable access to qualified legal experts now more than ever."

"In the past few years, due to a variety of shifts in legislation, regulation, and technology, the adult entertainment industry has seen a massive evolution where tens of thousands of entertainers have gone into business for themselves and become masters of their own paths," Silverstein said. "I have learned that nearly every adult entertainer has substantial legal needs and questions that vary tremendously: from content production contracts and liability, to criminal defense, and even simple business setup and maintenance. Adult entertainers have long been looking for a cost-effective solution to the unique challenges they face when doing business, and I believe we have finally created it."

According to the announcement, the subscription service offers "24/7 access to comprehensive legal resources, expertise, and information specific to the adult entertainment industry, with no retainer fee and packages starting at under one hundred dollars per month." Subscribers to the service "gain unlimited access to a mobile legal library of videos, articles and blog posts filled with information created and curated specifically for adult entertainers, as well as deeply discounted rates on additional paralegal and litigation services, as needed."

Premium Adult. Law subscribers also receive "monthly individualized one-on-one legal consulting time with an experienced attorney from Silverstein Legal." Subscribers can upgrade, downgrade or cancel their subscription anytime, and "unlike most legal services, there's no hefty retainer to pay upfront," the announcement states.

"During the past 15 years I have had the privilege of working with and getting to know this truly special group of entrepreneurs, and it has been an incredibly rewarding experience fighting for freedom of expression alongside some of the most amazing people I've ever met," Silverstein said.

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Adult Site Broker Launches New Affiliate Program

Adult Site Broker has announced the launch of a new affiliate program, Adult Site Broker Cash, which pays affiliates for referring site buyers and sellers to the brokerage.

According to the launch announcement, the new affiliate program "pays referral fees of up to 20% for bringing them new sellers and buyers of websites and companies." Sending one to two sellers or buyers over a 6-month period results in being paid 10% out of Adult Site Broker's broker commission on closed deals, referring three to four yields a 15% payout and 5 or more brings a payout of 20% over.

"We decided to formalize our referral program into a full-fledged affiliate program," Adult Site Broker CEO Bruce Friedman said of the decision to launch the new affiliate program. "We're excited about giving our affiliates the chance to earn large amounts of money."

The launch of the Adult Site Broker Cash is the latest in a series of announcements from the brokerage, which began broadcasting a new podcast in mid-May and launched an upgraded website less than two weeks later.

According to the Adult Site Broker Cash signup page, the new program is seeking an affiliate manager to help operate the new program. Source: Company Website

April 16: YNOT Network, LP : Pornhub Partners with Pineapple Support for Self-Care 'Competition'

Pineapple Support is launching a "competition" with Pornhub to highlight the importance of self-care. The competition invites those in the adult industry to share their favorite self-care activities during the lockdowns caused by the COVID-19 outbreak across the world. Whose self-care tips, tricks and tactics will win?!

Pornhub will provide a $100 voucher which can be used to purchase merchandise from its online store to a random winner that will be selected on May 1st. The competition runs in conjunction with Pineapple Support's self-care month throughout April, during which the organization will raise awareness around how self-care practices can be beneficial to mental health and wellbeing.

"We're committed to our ongoing support of individual care and self-care, and we believe that a healthy community can only arise from when each individual member's mental health is being cared for first," said Vice President of Pornhub Corey Price. "Our global community is going through a crisis with the COVID-19 pandemic and we are working on making sure we can all take care of ourselves so that we can take care of each other. Let's take the time to stay home, self isolate, and take care of ourselves."

"We're working to raise morale by asking people to share how you practice self-care," said PIneapple Support Founder Leya Tanit. "Throughout the month of April we will also be sharing videos and blogs on self-care at home, including workouts, yoga, nutrition, breathing exercise and more. We would also like to encourage our followers to send in videos to help others to keep mentally and physically healthy during isolation/lockdown. Let's help each other feel a little less alone."

Pineapple Support was founded in 2018 by Tanit in response to losses in the adult industry from depression, addiction and other mental illnesses.

March 24: YNOT Network, LP: Segpay Celebrates 15 Years in Business

Online payment processor Segpay announced today that one April, it will reach a major milestone for the company - its 15th year in business. To mark the occasion, Segpay is launching a "year-long integrated marketing campaign to promote new payment processing options and enhanced merchant service offerings-all backed by unmatched customer service."

"Over the past 15 years Segpay has developed a stellar reputation, by focusing on paying and always putting its clients first," the company said in its announcement. "Today, Segpay is trusted by the biggest and best-known brands in the high-risk payment category. It offers state of the art payment processing services via a robust, full-featured platform that includes proprietary gateway technologies and a cutting-edge Fraud Mitigation System."

Headquartered in Deerfield Beach, Florida, Segpay's reach has expanded globally and the company now has offices and outposts around the world, including London, Dublin, Toronto and Manila.

"We listen and learn from our merchants and this feedback has been the key to our 15- years of success," said Segpay CEO Cathy Beardsley. "It's our goal to continue to be on the forefront of the ever-changing rules and regulations to ensure safe, secure and compliant payment processing for our merchants."

Segpay also has unveiled a commemorative logo to mark its 15th anniversary, developed by the company's long-time agency partner Creaxion. Segpay said the new branding will replace the company's traditional logo across all advertising platforms over the next year.

"The number 15 is centered in the new logo to symbolize strength and utilizes Segpay's unique 'arrow' icon to complete the 5 in the number," Segpay noted in its announcement. "The dark blue color in the Segpay brand identity conveys trust, transparency and stability.

January 10: YNOT Network, LP: FanCentro Launches #FCAid Campaign to Aid Australian Bushfire Disaster

FanCentro has announced the launch of a new initiative to bring assistance to those affected by the bushfires raging in Australia. The campaign, #FCAid, was "launched today by the FanCentro team, together with influencers to encourage fans to donate to this important cause," the company said in a release announcing the start of #FCAid.

Under the initiative, influencers who opt in to #FCAid will receive a special "SOS Australia" tab on their profile, FanCentro said in its announcement. When fans visit this tab, they're able to make a donation which is then sent to the Australia Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery Fund.

"It's been amazing to watch so many of our influencers launching independent, altruistic campaigns to raise money for those affected by the devastating fires in Australia," said Stan Fiskin, CEO of FanCentro. "After learning how difficult it was for our influencers to manage all the donations and requests for content they're receiving by themselves, we knew we needed to help."

Fiskin said that with #FCAid, "influencers can raise money for important causes like this using FanCentro's suite of social media influencer tools."

"I hope with this initiative, we can make a significant impact on Australia, its people and the wildlife that calls the area home," Fiskin added. "However, to do this, FanCentro needs your help to spread the word about how influencers and fans can raise funds to help these fire-ravaged areas."

#FCAid donations start at a minimum of $5.00. Fans who donate $10.00 or more will receive a special piece of bonus content from the influencer through whom they donate.

"By joining #FCAid, influencers have no receipts to track and will simply receive a list of fans who donated so they can send them bonus content," FanCentro said in its announcement.

"Avoiding PR Mistakes That Can Damage Your Brand" will cover common PR mistakes, whether it's a good idea for brands to be part of political and/or hot button issues, challenges in and out of the industry for adult brands, and why brands need to trust professionals when it comes to PR. The seminar is part of the webmaster track and geared exclusively for businesses.

"I'm excited to be part of this panel, because it will help people. If you can, definitely attend the seminar and be ready to take notes or maybe even hire a publicist," says Erika Icon, Owner and Publicist.

Registering is free for the industry, and you can choose a talent or webmaster/business ticket. More info is available at hopin.to/events/ynot-summit-2020.

HarperTheFox and Max MoosemanIn a detailed primer on creating live animated characters the couple presented at the all-virtual YNOT Summit on Monday, HarperTheFox and Max Mooseman talked about the process of creating Abby Oddly, the world's first live hentai character - and how that process is changing as the technology used to do it is refined and enhanced.

"I wouldn't say you'll be able to walk away from this today and just go make one (a character like Abby) for yourself and just go do it," Max said at the start of the session. "There are a lot of applications to learn, there's a lot of hardware to acquire, it's a pretty technical process and it's changing all the time - it's a really fast-moving technology."

At the same time, Harper and Max explained, "you shouldn't be discouraged."

"Stick around and listen to all the pieces, because we're going to give you the roadmap we took, as well as some of the changes that we know are happening," Max said, adding that when he and Harper first got started on creating Abby, "we had no animation background, we had no programming, no networking background, basically other than camming we had none of the skill set needed to build something like this - and we learned it from scratch." In terms of time frame, Max said from when they first started learning how to use all the necessary hardware and software to when they went live with Abby was a "part-time, six or seven-month process."

Harper and Max began the heart of the session by briefly addressing the backstory and inspiration for Abby, then turning to real nuts and bolts of the process, listing the necessary software and hardware components for creating a live cartoon cam performer of your own.

June 22: YNOT Network, LP : Paxum Issues Statement on Wirecard Bank Rumors

PaxumMONTREAL - Payment processing service provider Paxum has issued a statement to its clients "in relation to the recent publicity regarding Wirecard accounting irregularities," stating that the company "is following the situation."

"We feel it is important to publicly address the Wirecard situation to avoid unnecessary speculation and apprehension from our clients." said Paxum CEO Octav Moise. "We would like to reassure our clients that Paxum, as a regulated financial entity, holds accounts with numerous banks and financial institutions worldwide. Should we ever feel that Wirecard or any other bank is not an appropriate processing partner, Paxum will utilize an alternative bank to process your payments, and we will provide you with that bank's EUR funding instructions. Your incoming funding and outgoing payments will continue arriving as usual and without any interruptions."

In its statement, Paxum added that the company has "always had strong risk mitigation policies in place, along with safeguards that ensure our clients' funds are secure."

"This is why we are not dependent on our banking partners' financial viability, and why Paxum has always weathered similar situations and continued to conduct business without interruption," the statement continued.

June 18: YNOT Network, LP : Trump Exec Order, New Bill in Senate Take Aim at Section 230

Section 230 in the crosshairsJust over two months ago, I posed the question: When the COVID-19 dust settles, what will become of Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act? As it turns out, we may be getting our first hints of the answer to that question while the dust from the pandemic is still clouding the air.

On May 28, President Donald Trump signed the "Executive Order on Preventing Online Censorship," days after having one of his tweets flagged as "potentially misleading" by Twitter.

More recently, U.S. Senator Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) introduced the "Limiting Section 230 Immunity to Good Samaritans Act," a bill intended to "empower Americans to sue Big Tech companies who act in bad faith by selectively censoring political speech and hiding content created by their competitors," according to its sponsors.

In seeking to curb the immunity afforded to operators of interactive web services with respect to expression published by third-party users of their platforms, both Trump and Hawley want to tie the grant of immunity to a promise of political neutrality.

In remarks he made upon signing the executive order, Trump asserted that a "small handful of powerful social media monopolies controls a vast portion of all public and private communications in the United States" and that to this point, thanks to Section 230, those monopolies have "had unchecked power to censor, restrict, edit, shape, hide, alter virtually any form of communication between private citizens and large public audiences."

"There's no precedent in American history for so small a number of corporations to control so large a sphere of human interaction," Trump continued.

July 21: YNOT Network, LP : Loyalfans.com Launches iOS App for Creators

Premium content sharing platform Loyalfans.com is thrilled to announce that the Loyalfans Creator App for iOS is available now. Content creators can manage their businesses and stay in touch with their most loyal fans directly from any iOS device.

Download the app in the App Store under "Loyalfans Creators."

The Loyalfans app makes it easy to post fresh new content, keep in touch with followers and subscribers, monitor site activity, and check income stats in real time.

"We are beyond excited about the Loyalfans Creator App, located front and center in the App Store," said Loyalfans' co-founder Eduard A. Braileanu. "Creators have the power to run their businesses from the palm of their hands with the app - and the possibilities for connection are endless."

Functionality includes video, audio, image, and locked messaging; post scheduling; and timeline and video store posting (with desktop-comparable options to allow for public viewing and/or limit access to followers or subscribers only). Creators can also check their balances live; adjust pricing settings; monitor subscriptions, rebills, and cancellations; and receive push notifications when a message is incoming - with more features coming soon!

"We hope that everyone is able to utilize the Loyalfans App to help take their creative capacity to the next level," Braileanu added. "Loyalfans is committed to providing the most cutting-edge tools imaginable, all in an empowering, model-centered environment that puts the needs of community first."

The Android version of the Loyalfans Creator App is coming soon.

On Loyalfans, artists and content creators can turn their inventiveness and influence into thriving businesses via the most advanced technology and innovative features available. The site's features and tools include customizable messaging, live streaming, video chat, audio recording and podcasting, video and photo sharing, and more.

Loyalfans prides itself on transparency, inclusivity, authenticity, and stability.

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Corey D. Silverstein Esq. Launches Adult. Law

Adult industry attorney Corey D. Silverstein today announced the launch of Adult. Law, describing it as a "groundbreaking new subscription service to legal resources for adult entertainers (that) offers 24/7 access to legal expertise with no retainer fee."

In his announcement, Silverstein said he launched Adult. Law "as a way to meet the needs of a rising population of small business owners and workers that need affordable access to qualified legal experts now more than ever."

"In the past few years, due to a variety of shifts in legislation, regulation, and technology, the adult entertainment industry has seen a massive evolution where tens of thousands of entertainers have gone into business for themselves and become masters of their own paths," Silverstein said. "I have learned that nearly every adult entertainer has substantial legal needs and questions that vary tremendously: from content production contracts and liability, to criminal defense, and even simple business setup and maintenance. Adult entertainers have long been looking for a cost-effective solution to the unique challenges they face when doing business, and I believe we have finally created it."

According to the announcement, the subscription service offers "24/7 access to comprehensive legal resources, expertise, and information specific to the adult entertainment industry, with no retainer fee and packages starting at under one hundred dollars per month." Subscribers to the service "gain unlimited access to a mobile legal library of videos, articles and blog posts filled with information created and curated specifically for adult entertainers, as well as deeply discounted rates on additional paralegal and litigation services, as needed."

Premium Adult. Law subscribers also receive "monthly individualized one-on-one legal consulting time with an experienced attorney from Silverstein Legal." Subscribers can upgrade, downgrade or cancel their subscription anytime, and "unlike most legal services, there's no hefty retainer to pay upfront," the announcement states.

"During the past 15 years I have had the privilege of working with and getting to know this truly special group of entrepreneurs, and it has been an incredibly rewarding experience fighting for freedom of expression alongside some of the most amazing people I've ever met," Silverstein said.

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Adult Site Broker Launches New Affiliate Program

Adult Site Broker has announced the launch of a new affiliate program, Adult Site Broker Cash, which pays affiliates for referring site buyers and sellers to the brokerage.

According to the launch announcement, the new affiliate program "pays referral fees of up to 20% for bringing them new sellers and buyers of websites and companies." Sending one to two sellers or buyers over a 6-month period results in being paid 10% out of Adult Site Broker's broker commission on closed deals, referring three to four yields a 15% payout and 5 or more brings a payout of 20% over.

"We decided to formalize our referral program into a full-fledged affiliate program," Adult Site Broker CEO Bruce Friedman said of the decision to launch the new affiliate program. "We're excited about giving our affiliates the chance to earn large amounts of money."

The launch of the Adult Site Broker Cash is the latest in a series of announcements from the brokerage, which began broadcasting a new podcast in mid-May and launched an upgraded website less than two weeks later.

According to the Adult Site Broker Cash signup page, the new program is seeking an affiliate manager to help operate the new program. Source: Company Website

April 16: YNOT Network, LP : Pornhub Partners with Pineapple Support for Self-Care 'Competition'

Pineapple Support is launching a "competition" with Pornhub to highlight the importance of self-care. The competition invites those in the adult industry to share their favorite self-care activities during the lockdowns caused by the COVID-19 outbreak across the world. Whose self-care tips, tricks and tactics will win?!

Pornhub will provide a $100 voucher which can be used to purchase merchandise from its online store to a random winner that will be selected on May 1st. The competition runs in conjunction with Pineapple Support's self-care month throughout April, during which the organization will raise awareness around how self-care practices can be beneficial to mental health and wellbeing.

"We're committed to our ongoing support of individual care and self-care, and we believe that a healthy community can only arise from when each individual member's mental health is being cared for first," said Vice President of Pornhub Corey Price. "Our global community is going through a crisis with the COVID-19 pandemic and we are working on making sure we can all take care of ourselves so that we can take care of each other. Let's take the time to stay home, self isolate, and take care of ourselves."

"We're working to raise morale by asking people to share how you practice self-care," said PIneapple Support Founder Leya Tanit. "Throughout the month of April we will also be sharing videos and blogs on self-care at home, including workouts, yoga, nutrition, breathing exercise and more. We would also like to encourage our followers to send in videos to help others to keep mentally and physically healthy during isolation/lockdown. Let's help each other feel a little less alone."

Pineapple Support was founded in 2018 by Tanit in response to losses in the adult industry from depression, addiction and other mental illnesses.

March 24: YNOT Network, LP: Segpay Celebrates 15 Years in Business

Online payment processor Segpay announced today that one April, it will reach a major milestone for the company - its 15th year in business. To mark the occasion, Segpay is launching a "year-long integrated marketing campaign to promote new payment processing options and enhanced merchant service offerings-all backed by unmatched customer service."

"Over the past 15 years Segpay has developed a stellar reputation, by focusing on paying and always putting its clients first," the company said in its announcement. "Today, Segpay is trusted by the biggest and best-known brands in the high-risk payment category. It offers state of the art payment processing services via a robust, full-featured platform that includes proprietary gateway technologies and a cutting-edge Fraud Mitigation System."

Headquartered in Deerfield Beach, Florida, Segpay's reach has expanded globally and the company now has offices and outposts around the world, including London, Dublin, Toronto and Manila.

"We listen and learn from our merchants and this feedback has been the key to our 15- years of success," said Segpay CEO Cathy Beardsley. "It's our goal to continue to be on the forefront of the ever-changing rules and regulations to ensure safe, secure and compliant payment processing for our merchants."

Segpay also has unveiled a commemorative logo to mark its 15th anniversary, developed by the company's long-time agency partner Creaxion. Segpay said the new branding will replace the company's traditional logo across all advertising platforms over the next year.

"The number 15 is centered in the new logo to symbolize strength and utilizes Segpay's unique 'arrow' icon to complete the 5 in the number," Segpay noted in its announcement. "The dark blue color in the Segpay brand identity conveys trust, transparency and stability.

January 10: YNOT Network, LP: FanCentro Launches #FCAid Campaign to Aid Australian Bushfire Disaster

FanCentro has announced the launch of a new initiative to bring assistance to those affected by the bushfires raging in Australia. The campaign, #FCAid, was "launched today by the FanCentro team, together with influencers to encourage fans to donate to this important cause," the company said in a release announcing the start of #FCAid.

Under the initiative, influencers who opt in to #FCAid will receive a special "SOS Australia" tab on their profile, FanCentro said in its announcement. When fans visit this tab, they're able to make a donation which is then sent to the Australia Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery Fund.

"It's been amazing to watch so many of our influencers launching independent, altruistic campaigns to raise money for those affected by the devastating fires in Australia," said Stan Fiskin, CEO of FanCentro. "After learning how difficult it was for our influencers to manage all the donations and requests for content they're receiving by themselves, we knew we needed to help."

Fiskin said that with #FCAid, "influencers can raise money for important causes like this using FanCentro's suite of social media influencer tools."

"I hope with this initiative, we can make a significant impact on Australia, its people and the wildlife that calls the area home," Fiskin added. "However, to do this, FanCentro needs your help to spread the word about how influencers and fans can raise funds to help these fire-ravaged areas."

#FCAid donations start at a minimum of $5.00. Fans who donate $10.00 or more will receive a special piece of bonus content from the influencer through whom they donate.

"By joining #FCAid, influencers have no receipts to track and will simply receive a list of fans who donated so they can send them bonus content," FanCentro said in its announcement.

June 18: YNOT Network, LP : Trump Exec Order, New Bill in Senate Take Aim at Section 230

Section 230 in the crosshairsJust over two months ago, I posed the question: When the COVID-19 dust settles, what will become of Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act? As it turns out, we may be getting our first hints of the answer to that question while the dust from the pandemic is still clouding the air.

On May 28, President Donald Trump signed the "Executive Order on Preventing Online Censorship," days after having one of his tweets flagged as "potentially misleading" by Twitter.

More recently, U.S. Senator Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) introduced the "Limiting Section 230 Immunity to Good Samaritans Act," a bill intended to "empower Americans to sue Big Tech companies who act in bad faith by selectively censoring political speech and hiding content created by their competitors," according to its sponsors.

In seeking to curb the immunity afforded to operators of interactive web services with respect to expression published by third-party users of their platforms, both Trump and Hawley want to tie the grant of immunity to a promise of political neutrality.

In remarks he made upon signing the executive order, Trump asserted that a "small handful of powerful social media monopolies controls a vast portion of all public and private communications in the United States" and that to this point, thanks to Section 230, those monopolies have "had unchecked power to censor, restrict, edit, shape, hide, alter virtually any form of communication between private citizens and large public audiences."

"There's no precedent in American history for so small a number of corporations to control so large a sphere of human interaction," Trump continued.

The Commission ruled that Hay had illegally taken fees from those he represented, that he ignored their no lists, put them in unsafe working environments, misrepresented the legality of his contract, engaged in inappropriate sexual relationships with his performers, and failed to work in the best interest of those he represented. None of this is acceptable, under either California law or ethical production in the adult industry.

Unethical representation thrives when there is little to educate performers about what is right, standard, and acceptable in a contract, or within the adult industry.

Flirt4Free recently announced the addition of Money Network to their catalog of payout options for models based in the United States. Money Network has gained popularity in the gig economy in recent years for their easy-to-use pre-paid cards and intuitive money management app.

urn:contentItem:60DH-MN91-JB4F-Y2JR-00000-00July 21, 2020: YNOT Network, LP : The Rub PRs Erika Icon Slated to Speak on PR Panel at YNOT Summit2020-07-22T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 21, 2020: YNOT Network, LP : The Rub PRs Erika Icon Slated to Speak on PR Panel at YNOT Summit

Erika Icon, Owner of The Rub PR, is slated to speak on a PR panel this Wednesday, July 22nd at 12pm PST/3pm EST at the YNOT Summit ynotsummit.com.

Icon will be joining Todd Yanks from Yanks VR. YNOT Owner Jay Kopita will be moderating the panel and also sharing his insight into the topic. "Avoiding PR Mistakes That Can Damage Your Brand" will cover common PR mistakes, whether it's a good idea for brands to be part of political and/or hot button issues, challenges in and out of the industry for adult brands, and why brands need to trust professionals when it comes to PR. The seminar is part of the webmaster track and geared exclusively for businesses.

"I'm excited to be part of this panel, because it will help people. If you can, definitely attend the seminar and be ready to take notes or maybe even hire a publicist," says Erika Icon, Owner and Publicist.

Registering is free for the industry, and you can choose a talent or webmaster/business ticket. More info is available at hopin.to/events/ynot-summit-2020.

YNOT Network, LP engages in the ownership and operation of a resource Web site for adult Webmasters on the Internet. The company was founded in 1996 and is based in Glendale, California with additional offices in Texas and Florida.

July 21: YNOT Network, LP : Loyalfans.com Launches iOS App for Creators

Premium content sharing platform Loyalfans.com is thrilled to announce that the Loyalfans Creator App for iOS is available now. Content creators can manage their businesses and stay in touch with their most loyal fans directly from any iOS device.

Download the app in the App Store under "Loyalfans Creators."

The Loyalfans app makes it easy to post fresh new content, keep in touch with followers and subscribers, monitor site activity, and check income stats in real time.

"We are beyond excited about the Loyalfans Creator App, located front and center in the App Store," said Loyalfans' co-founder Eduard A. Braileanu. "Creators have the power to run their businesses from the palm of their hands with the app - and the possibilities for connection are endless."

Functionality includes video, audio, image, and locked messaging; post scheduling; and timeline and video store posting (with desktop-comparable options to allow for public viewing and/or limit access to followers or subscribers only). Creators can also check their balances live; adjust pricing settings; monitor subscriptions, rebills, and cancellations; and receive push notifications when a message is incoming - with more features coming soon!

"We hope that everyone is able to utilize the Loyalfans App to help take their creative capacity to the next level," Braileanu added. "Loyalfans is committed to providing the most cutting-edge tools imaginable, all in an empowering, model-centered environment that puts the needs of community first."

The Android version of the Loyalfans Creator App is coming soon.

On Loyalfans, artists and content creators can turn their inventiveness and influence into thriving businesses via the most advanced technology and innovative features available. The site's features and tools include customizable messaging, live streaming, video chat, audio recording and podcasting, video and photo sharing, and more.

Loyalfans prides itself on transparency, inclusivity, authenticity, and stability.

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Corey D. Silverstein Esq. Launches Adult. Law

Adult industry attorney Corey D. Silverstein today announced the launch of Adult. Law, describing it as a "groundbreaking new subscription service to legal resources for adult entertainers (that) offers 24/7 access to legal expertise with no retainer fee."

In his announcement, Silverstein said he launched Adult. Law "as a way to meet the needs of a rising population of small business owners and workers that need affordable access to qualified legal experts now more than ever."

"In the past few years, due to a variety of shifts in legislation, regulation, and technology, the adult entertainment industry has seen a massive evolution where tens of thousands of entertainers have gone into business for themselves and become masters of their own paths," Silverstein said. "I have learned that nearly every adult entertainer has substantial legal needs and questions that vary tremendously: from content production contracts and liability, to criminal defense, and even simple business setup and maintenance. Adult entertainers have long been looking for a cost-effective solution to the unique challenges they face when doing business, and I believe we have finally created it."

According to the announcement, the subscription service offers "24/7 access to comprehensive legal resources, expertise, and information specific to the adult entertainment industry, with no retainer fee and packages starting at under one hundred dollars per month." Subscribers to the service "gain unlimited access to a mobile legal library of videos, articles and blog posts filled with information created and curated specifically for adult entertainers, as well as deeply discounted rates on additional paralegal and litigation services, as needed."

Premium Adult. Law subscribers also receive "monthly individualized one-on-one legal consulting time with an experienced attorney from Silverstein Legal." Subscribers can upgrade, downgrade or cancel their subscription anytime, and "unlike most legal services, there's no hefty retainer to pay upfront," the announcement states.

"During the past 15 years I have had the privilege of working with and getting to know this truly special group of entrepreneurs, and it has been an incredibly rewarding experience fighting for freedom of expression alongside some of the most amazing people I've ever met," Silverstein said.

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Adult Site Broker Launches New Affiliate Program

Adult Site Broker has announced the launch of a new affiliate program, Adult Site Broker Cash, which pays affiliates for referring site buyers and sellers to the brokerage.

According to the launch announcement, the new affiliate program "pays referral fees of up to 20% for bringing them new sellers and buyers of websites and companies." Sending one to two sellers or buyers over a 6-month period results in being paid 10% out of Adult Site Broker's broker commission on closed deals, referring three to four yields a 15% payout and 5 or more brings a payout of 20% over.

"We decided to formalize our referral program into a full-fledged affiliate program," Adult Site Broker CEO Bruce Friedman said of the decision to launch the new affiliate program. "We're excited about giving our affiliates the chance to earn large amounts of money."

The launch of the Adult Site Broker Cash is the latest in a series of announcements from the brokerage, which began broadcasting a new podcast in mid-May and launched an upgraded website less than two weeks later.

According to the Adult Site Broker Cash signup page, the new program is seeking an affiliate manager to help operate the new program. Source: Company Website

April 16: YNOT Network, LP : Pornhub Partners with Pineapple Support for Self-Care 'Competition'

Pineapple Support is launching a "competition" with Pornhub to highlight the importance of self-care. The competition invites those in the adult industry to share their favorite self-care activities during the lockdowns caused by the COVID-19 outbreak across the world. Whose self-care tips, tricks and tactics will win?!

Pornhub will provide a $100 voucher which can be used to purchase merchandise from its online store to a random winner that will be selected on May 1st. The competition runs in conjunction with Pineapple Support's self-care month throughout April, during which the organization will raise awareness around how self-care practices can be beneficial to mental health and wellbeing.

"We're committed to our ongoing support of individual care and self-care, and we believe that a healthy community can only arise from when each individual member's mental health is being cared for first," said Vice President of Pornhub Corey Price. "Our global community is going through a crisis with the COVID-19 pandemic and we are working on making sure we can all take care of ourselves so that we can take care of each other. Let's take the time to stay home, self isolate, and take care of ourselves."

"We're working to raise morale by asking people to share how you practice self-care," said PIneapple Support Founder Leya Tanit. "Throughout the month of April we will also be sharing videos and blogs on self-care at home, including workouts, yoga, nutrition, breathing exercise and more. We would also like to encourage our followers to send in videos to help others to keep mentally and physically healthy during isolation/lockdown. Let's help each other feel a little less alone."

Pineapple Support was founded in 2018 by Tanit in response to losses in the adult industry from depression, addiction and other mental illnesses.

March 24: YNOT Network, LP: Segpay Celebrates 15 Years in Business

Online payment processor Segpay announced today that one April, it will reach a major milestone for the company - its 15th year in business. To mark the occasion, Segpay is launching a "year-long integrated marketing campaign to promote new payment processing options and enhanced merchant service offerings-all backed by unmatched customer service."

"Over the past 15 years Segpay has developed a stellar reputation, by focusing on paying and always putting its clients first," the company said in its announcement. "Today, Segpay is trusted by the biggest and best-known brands in the high-risk payment category. It offers state of the art payment processing services via a robust, full-featured platform that includes proprietary gateway technologies and a cutting-edge Fraud Mitigation System."

Headquartered in Deerfield Beach, Florida, Segpay's reach has expanded globally and the company now has offices and outposts around the world, including London, Dublin, Toronto and Manila.

"We listen and learn from our merchants and this feedback has been the key to our 15- years of success," said Segpay CEO Cathy Beardsley. "It's our goal to continue to be on the forefront of the ever-changing rules and regulations to ensure safe, secure and compliant payment processing for our merchants."

Segpay also has unveiled a commemorative logo to mark its 15th anniversary, developed by the company's long-time agency partner Creaxion. Segpay said the new branding will replace the company's traditional logo across all advertising platforms over the next year.

"The number 15 is centered in the new logo to symbolize strength and utilizes Segpay's unique 'arrow' icon to complete the 5 in the number," Segpay noted in its announcement. "The dark blue color in the Segpay brand identity conveys trust, transparency and stability.

January 10: YNOT Network, LP: FanCentro Launches #FCAid Campaign to Aid Australian Bushfire Disaster

FanCentro has announced the launch of a new initiative to bring assistance to those affected by the bushfires raging in Australia. The campaign, #FCAid, was "launched today by the FanCentro team, together with influencers to encourage fans to donate to this important cause," the company said in a release announcing the start of #FCAid.

Under the initiative, influencers who opt in to #FCAid will receive a special "SOS Australia" tab on their profile, FanCentro said in its announcement. When fans visit this tab, they're able to make a donation which is then sent to the Australia Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery Fund.

"It's been amazing to watch so many of our influencers launching independent, altruistic campaigns to raise money for those affected by the devastating fires in Australia," said Stan Fiskin, CEO of FanCentro. "After learning how difficult it was for our influencers to manage all the donations and requests for content they're receiving by themselves, we knew we needed to help."

Fiskin said that with #FCAid, "influencers can raise money for important causes like this using FanCentro's suite of social media influencer tools."

"I hope with this initiative, we can make a significant impact on Australia, its people and the wildlife that calls the area home," Fiskin added. "However, to do this, FanCentro needs your help to spread the word about how influencers and fans can raise funds to help these fire-ravaged areas."

#FCAid donations start at a minimum of $5.00. Fans who donate $10.00 or more will receive a special piece of bonus content from the influencer through whom they donate.

"By joining #FCAid, influencers have no receipts to track and will simply receive a list of fans who donated so they can send them bonus content," FanCentro said in its announcement.

July 21: YNOT Summit: HarperTheFox & Max on Creating Live Hentai Cam Models

HarperTheFox and Max MoosemanIn a detailed primer on creating live animated characters the couple presented at the all-virtual YNOT Summit on Monday, HarperTheFox and Max Mooseman talked about the process of creating Abby Oddly, the world's first live hentai character - and how that process is changing as the technology used to do it is refined and enhanced.

From the outset, Harper and Max were clear that while the session would be filled with information, viewers who want to follow in their footsteps are facing a steep learning curve.

"I wouldn't say you'll be able to walk away from this today and just go make one (a character like Abby) for yourself and just go do it," Max said at the start of the session. "There are a lot of applications to learn, there's a lot of hardware to acquire, it's a pretty technical process and it's changing all the time - it's a really fast-moving technology."

At the same time, Harper and Max explained, "you shouldn't be discouraged."

"Stick around and listen to all the pieces, because we're going to give you the roadmap we took, as well as some of the changes that we know are happening," Max said, adding that when he and Harper first got started on creating Abby, "we had no animation background, we had no programming, no networking background, basically other than camming we had none of the skill set needed to build something like this - and we learned it from scratch." In terms of time frame, Max said from when they first started learning how to use all the necessary hardware and software to when they went live with Abby was a "part-time, six or seven-month process."

Harper and Max began the heart of the session by briefly addressing the backstory and inspiration for Abby, then turning to real nuts and bolts of the process, listing the necessary software and hardware components for creating a live cartoon cam performer of your own.

Among the core equipment and software needed are Adobe Creative Cloud, Newtek NDI, an RTMP broadcaster, a MIDI controller, two computers, a router, two microphones and a webcam.

June 18: YNOT Network, LP : Trump Exec Order, New Bill in Senate Take Aim at Section 230

Section 230 in the crosshairsJust over two months ago, I posed the question: When the COVID-19 dust settles, what will become of Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act? As it turns out, we may be getting our first hints of the answer to that question while the dust from the pandemic is still clouding the air.

On May 28, President Donald Trump signed the "Executive Order on Preventing Online Censorship," days after having one of his tweets flagged as "potentially misleading" by Twitter.

More recently, U.S. Senator Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) introduced the "Limiting Section 230 Immunity to Good Samaritans Act," a bill intended to "empower Americans to sue Big Tech companies who act in bad faith by selectively censoring political speech and hiding content created by their competitors," according to its sponsors.

In seeking to curb the immunity afforded to operators of interactive web services with respect to expression published by third-party users of their platforms, both Trump and Hawley want to tie the grant of immunity to a promise of political neutrality.

In remarks he made upon signing the executive order, Trump asserted that a "small handful of powerful social media monopolies controls a vast portion of all public and private communications in the United States" and that to this point, thanks to Section 230, those monopolies have "had unchecked power to censor, restrict, edit, shape, hide, alter virtually any form of communication between private citizens and large public audiences."

"There's no precedent in American history for so small a number of corporations to control so large a sphere of human interaction," Trump continued.

urn:contentItem:60DH-MN91-JB4F-Y2JK-00000-00July 21, 2020: YNOT Summit: HarperTheFox & Max on Creating Live Hentai Cam Models2020-07-22T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 21, 2020: YNOT Summit: HarperTheFox & Max on Creating Live Hentai Cam Models

HarperTheFox and Max MoosemanIn a detailed primer on creating live animated characters the couple presented at the all-virtual YNOT Summit on Monday, HarperTheFox and Max Mooseman talked about the process of creating Abby Oddly, the world's first live hentai character - and how that process is changing as the technology used to do it is refined and enhanced.

From the outset, Harper and Max were clear that while the session would be filled with information, viewers who want to follow in their footsteps are facing a steep learning curve.

"I wouldn't say you'll be able to walk away from this today and just go make one (a character like Abby) for yourself and just go do it," Max said at the start of the session. "There are a lot of applications to learn, there's a lot of hardware to acquire, it's a pretty technical process and it's changing all the time - it's a really fast-moving technology."

At the same time, Harper and Max explained, "you shouldn't be discouraged."

"Stick around and listen to all the pieces, because we're going to give you the roadmap we took, as well as some of the changes that we know are happening," Max said, adding that when he and Harper first got started on creating Abby, "we had no animation background, we had no programming, no networking background, basically other than camming we had none of the skill set needed to build something like this - and we learned it from scratch." In terms of time frame, Max said from when they first started learning how to use all the necessary hardware and software to when they went live with Abby was a "part-time, six or seven-month process."

Harper and Max began the heart of the session by briefly addressing the backstory and inspiration for Abby, then turning to real nuts and bolts of the process, listing the necessary software and hardware components for creating a live cartoon cam performer of your own.

Among the core equipment and software needed are Adobe Creative Cloud, Newtek NDI, an RTMP broadcaster, a MIDI controller, two computers, a router, two microphones and a webcam. The couple also said it's important to note that not all cam networks are equipped to handle a

Detailing how the two computers are used, Harper and Max presented a side-by-side chart listing the functions of each computer (see below).

June 08: YNOT Network, LP : Corey D. Silverstein Esq. Launches Adult. Law

Adult industry attorney Corey D. Silverstein today announced the launch of Adult. Law, describing it as a "groundbreaking new subscription service to legal resources for adult entertainers (that) offers 24/7 access to legal expertise with no retainer fee."

In his announcement, Silverstein said he launched Adult. Law "as a way to meet the needs of a rising population of small business owners and workers that need affordable access to qualified legal experts now more than ever."

"In the past few years, due to a variety of shifts in legislation, regulation, and technology, the adult entertainment industry has seen a massive evolution where tens of thousands of entertainers have gone into business for themselves and become masters of their own paths," Silverstein said. "I have learned that nearly every adult entertainer has substantial legal needs and questions that vary tremendously: from content production contracts and liability, to criminal defense, and even simple business setup and maintenance. Adult entertainers have long been looking for a cost-effective solution to the unique challenges they face when doing business, and I believe we have finally created it."

According to the announcement, the subscription service offers "24/7 access to comprehensive legal resources, expertise, and information specific to the adult entertainment industry, with no retainer fee and packages starting at under one hundred dollars per month." Subscribers to the service "gain unlimited access to a mobile legal library of videos, articles and blog posts filled with information created and curated specifically for adult entertainers, as well as deeply discounted rates on additional paralegal and litigation services, as needed."

Premium Adult. Law subscribers also receive "monthly individualized one-on-one legal consulting time with an experienced attorney from Silverstein Legal." Subscribers can upgrade, downgrade or cancel their subscription anytime, and "unlike most legal services, there's no hefty retainer to pay upfront," the announcement states.

"During the past 15 years I have had the privilege of working with and getting to know this truly special group of entrepreneurs, and it has been an incredibly rewarding experience fighting for freedom of expression alongside some of the most amazing people I've ever met," Silverstein said.

"Over the past 15 years Segpay has developed a stellar reputation, by focusing on paying and always putting its clients first," the company said in its announcement. "Today, Segpay is trusted by the biggest and best-known brands in the high-risk payment category. It offers state of the art payment processing services via a robust, full-featured platform that includes proprietary gateway technologies and a cutting-edge Fraud Mitigation System."

Headquartered in Deerfield Beach, Florida, Segpay's reach has expanded globally and the company now has offices and outposts around the world, including London, Dublin, Toronto and Manila.

"We listen and learn from our merchants and this feedback has been the key to our 15- years of success," said Segpay CEO Cathy Beardsley. "It's our goal to continue to be on the forefront of the ever-changing rules and regulations to ensure safe, secure and compliant payment processing for our merchants."

Segpay also has unveiled a commemorative logo to mark its 15th anniversary, developed by the company's long-time agency partner Creaxion. Segpay said the new branding will replace the company's traditional logo across all advertising platforms over the next year.

"The number 15 is centered in the new logo to symbolize strength and utilizes Segpay's unique 'arrow' icon to complete the 5 in the number," Segpay noted in its announcement. "The dark blue color in the Segpay brand identity conveys trust, transparency and stability.

January 10: YNOT Network, LP: FanCentro Launches #FCAid Campaign to Aid Australian Bushfire Disaster

The campaign, #FCAid, was "launched today by the FanCentro team, together with influencers to encourage fans to donate to this important cause," the company said in a release announcing the start of #FCAid.

Under the initiative, influencers who opt in to #FCAid will receive a special "SOS Australia" tab on their profile, FanCentro said in its announcement. When fans visit this tab, they're able to make a donation which is then sent to the Australia Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery Fund.

"It's been amazing to watch so many of our influencers launching independent, altruistic campaigns to raise money for those affected by the devastating fires in Australia," said Stan Fiskin, CEO of FanCentro. "After learning how difficult it was for our influencers to manage all the donations and requests for content they're receiving by themselves, we knew we needed to help."

Fiskin said that with #FCAid, "influencers can raise money for important causes like this using FanCentro's suite of social media influencer tools."

"I hope with this initiative, we can make a significant impact on Australia, its people and the wildlife that calls the area home," Fiskin added. "However, to do this, FanCentro needs your help to spread the word about how influencers and fans can raise funds to help these fire-ravaged areas."

#FCAid donations start at a minimum of $5.00. Fans who donate $10.00 or more will receive a special piece of bonus content from the influencer through whom they donate.

"By joining #FCAid, influencers have no receipts to track and will simply receive a list of fans who donated so they can send them bonus content," FanCentro said in its announcement.

June 18: YNOT Network, LP : Trump Exec Order, New Bill in Senate Take Aim at Section 230

Section 230 in the crosshairsJust over two months ago, I posed the question: When the COVID-19 dust settles, what will become of Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act? As it turns out, we may be getting our first hints of the answer to that question while the dust from the pandemic is still clouding the air.

On May 28, President Donald Trump signed the "Executive Order on Preventing Online Censorship," days after having one of his tweets flagged as "potentially misleading" by Twitter.

More recently, U.S. Senator Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) introduced the "Limiting Section 230 Immunity to Good Samaritans Act," a bill intended to "empower Americans to sue Big Tech companies who act in bad faith by selectively censoring political speech and hiding content created by their competitors," according to its sponsors.

In seeking to curb the immunity afforded to operators of interactive web services with respect to expression published by third-party users of their platforms, both Trump and Hawley want to tie the grant of immunity to a promise of political neutrality.

In remarks he made upon signing the executive order, Trump asserted that a "small handful of powerful social media monopolies controls a vast portion of all public and private communications in the United States" and that to this point, thanks to Section 230, those monopolies have "had unchecked power to censor, restrict, edit, shape, hide, alter virtually any form of communication between private citizens and large public audiences."

"There's no precedent in American history for so small a number of corporations to control so large a sphere of human interaction," Trump continued.

Recent events involving TikTok and Huawei reinforce our core view regarding the greater regionalisation of tech, and the growing influence of the cybersovereignty governance model Tech has become geopolitical, but that does not mean that a full splinternet is inevitable Similar events should be expected in the future, with an escalation always possible

Source: Company Website

July 07: Business Monitor International Inc.: Guyana And Suriname Continue To Attract IOCs Despite Political Uncertainty

We maintain our outlook for medium term crude oil production in Guyana as ExxonMobil positions Guyana at the centre of its investment strategy and restores production after technical issue. The commitment to exploration programmes from several international oil companies and ExxonMobil's farm-in to an offshore block constitutes an upside risk for Suriname's long term crude oi.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

Simon Longfield, CFO

Terence Alexander, Chief Operating Officer

Jon Ewing, Chief Technology Officer & Chief Marketing Officer

Diane Milliard, Global Head of HR and Recruitment

Gregory Roth, Global Head-Communications

Lyndsey Anderson, Global Head-Research
