urn:contentItem:60DR-Y5T1-DXKH-N1CD-00000-00July 22, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Pent-Up Investor Demand Paving Way For Smaller Brazilian Floats2020-07-23T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 22, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Pent-Up Investor Demand Paving Way For Smaller Brazilian Floats

Despite being home to one of the world's largest stock exchanges, Brazil has struggled to record a strong flow of IPO activity over recent years. We believe that deal levels on the Sao Paulo Stock Exchange (or commonly known as the Bovespa bourse) will also remain low in the near term, with the country expected to see a forecast sharp contraction in economic growth in 2020. At Fitch Solutions, we forecast the Brazilian econ.

INDEX

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

Business Monitor International Inc.

Key Stats

Estimated Revenue (TTM): $1 Million

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

2.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4296431365

Website: http://www.businessmonitor.com

Industry: Software and Technology Servic

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. The government's healthcare budget will come under pressure in the near term, as the Bahamas recovers from Hurricane Dorian and the Covid-19 impact. The Bahamas could increasingly attract investment from active pharmaceutical ingr.

Source: Company Website

May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

July 23: Business Monitor International Inc.: Netherlands 5G Spectrum Auction: High Prices For Small Market

The Netherlands has completed its initial 5G spectrum auction, raising EUR1.23bn. Bids were relatively high, reflecting the three incumbents' robust IoT pedigrees. The risk is that they may have overpaid in an effort to secure access to a small industrial IoT market.

T-Mobile appears to have come off worst in the auction, securing 70MHz.

Source: Company Website

July 22: Business Monitor International Inc.: Japanese Subsidies Will Further Benefit South East Asia's Ability To Attract Autos Investment

Japan's push to reduce its industries' reliance on Chinese manufacturing by subsidising the relocation of manufacturing facilities out of China and not only back to Japan, but also into the wider South East Asia region, will greatly benefit countries in South East Asia. One of the key themes that emerged from this first round of incentives is that the manufacturing of steel c.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: What Our Clients Want To Know: Commodities After Covid-19

On June 30, Fitch Solutions held a webinar, 'Commodities After-Covid-19: Trends And Opportunities', in which we discussed the short-term impact of the pandemic on commodities prices and long-term implications for the agribusiness and mining & metals sectors. In this article, we answer some of the most asked questions received during the webinar's Q&A session.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: USMCA Gives Mexico Advantage As Global Supply Chains Shift

The effectuation of the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) will compound the existing factors supporting Mexico as a beneficiary of automotive supply chain diversification. Mexico's comparatively attractive operating environment and proximity to the US and Canada inform our assessment that it will benefit from a reallocation of automotive production resources after the Covid-.

Source: Company Website

July 16: Business Monitor International Inc.: Argentina's Vehicle Production Faces Unprecedented Threat From Covid-19

The Covid-19 pandemic poses an unprecedented threat to Argentina's vehicle output as it causes disruption to production while also dampening the demand for new vehicles. The weak economic outlook will provide little support for Argentina's vehicle production industry as it will severely dampen the demand for new vehicles. In 2020, we expect Argentina's vehicle sales.

Source: Company Website

July 16: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spain To Impose Targeted Regional Lockdown As New Confirmed Covid-19 Cases Doubled

Targeted regional lockdown in Spain as new infection doubled post nationwide lockdown. ROVI's facility in Madrid to manufacture Moderna's Covid-19 vaccine candidate. 95% of Spain's population remains susceptible to Covid-19 virus.

Source: Company Website

July 15: Business Monitor International Inc.: Asia Autos Production: Japan Regains Second Place, But Is Not Without Challenges

In the most recent update of our Autos Production RRI, the Asia region's overall score has remained stable at 56.2 out of a possible 100. As such, the region maintains its position as the most attractive region for vehicle production globally, followed by Europe (53.8) and the Americas (43.4). The Asia region benefits from major automotive countries, such as China, Japan and India, all having large volume vehicle production, healthy completion, a good pool of skilled labour and strong automotive policies. However, production growth scores in these markets have fallen due to the spread of Covid-19. We highlight that Japan is not shielded from suppressed output amid the pandemic, which means that its overall score is being held back by its performance under our 'Vehicle production growth' indicator on our Risk/Reward Index.

Strength Of China's Autos Industry Keeps It On Top Asia - Autos Production Risk/Reward Index Heat Map

Note: Scores out of 100; higher score = more attractive market. Source: Fitch Solutions Autos Production Risk/Reward Index Main Regional Features And Latest Updates

In the most recent update of our Autos Production Risk/Reward Index (RRI), the Asia region's overall score has remained stable at 56.2 out of a possible 100.

July 14: Business Monitor International Inc.: Weak Economic Outlook Will Weigh On The Pharmaceutical Sector In The Maldives

Pharmaceutical market growth in the Maldives will remain on a low-growth trajectory due to restrictions in healthcare funds, as a result of ongoing economic weakness. The country's pharmaceutical imports will increase in line with government's commitment to improve health services. The majority of medicines will continue to be sourced from South Asian and European d.

Source: Company Website

July 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Generic Drugmakers Will See Increasing Opportunities In Mexico

This report from Fitch Solutions Country Risk & Industry Research is a product of Fitch Solutions Group Ltd, UK Company registration number 08789939 ('FSG'). FSG is an affiliate of Fitch Ratings Inc.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahrain Will Be Among Most Resilient GCC Autos Markets In 2020

Bahrain will suffer from a 'double whammy' of external shocks in the near term in the form of sharply lower oil prices and the spread of Covid-19, which will be damaging for both business and consumer spending on vehicles. Local business appetite for spending in areas such as fleet renewal will be highly limited over the coming period, as the domestic economy slows dramatical.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Brazilian Regulatory Authority Continues To Approve Covid-19 Vaccine Trials

The Brazilian National Regulatory Agency continues to approve vaccine trials in the country to tackle the Covid-19 pandemic. Further partnerships between Brazil and international vaccine developers likely to take place in H220 due to the country's high daily case count. Discordant government response continues to be detrimental to Brazil's Covid-19 reaction.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Japan Diversifies LNG Sources With Mozambique Investment

Japan has pledged support for the Area 1 Mozambique LNG project supporting the outlook for Mozambique LNG although significant delays to LNG projects in Mozambique appear inevitable as market conditions deteriorate. LNG from Mozambique would further expand Japan's current pool of LNG suppliers as it seeks further diversification of its import sources. Japan's LNG de.

Source: Company Website

July 09: Business Monitor International Inc.: Tanzania Continues To Shut Covid-19 Centres As No New Cases Reported For Two Months

Tanzania continues to shut down Covid-19 facilities as official numbers show a sharp decline in cases. Low healthcare spending per capita in Tanzania means healthcare facilities need to be used efficiently. Doubts about official Covid-19 figures remain. Tanzania continues to shut down Covid-19 facilities as official numbers show a sharp decline.

Source: Company Website

July 09: Business Monitor International Inc.: TikTok, Huawei, Regionalisation And The Splinternet

Recent events involving TikTok and Huawei reinforce our core view regarding the greater regionalisation of tech, and the growing influence of the cybersovereignty governance model Tech has become geopolitical, but that does not mean that a full splinternet is inevitable Similar events should be expected in the future, with an escalation always possible

Source: Company Website

July 07: Business Monitor International Inc.: Guyana And Suriname Continue To Attract IOCs Despite Political Uncertainty

We maintain our outlook for medium term crude oil production in Guyana as ExxonMobil positions Guyana at the centre of its investment strategy and restores production after technical issue. The commitment to exploration programmes from several international oil companies and ExxonMobil's farm-in to an offshore block constitutes an upside risk for Suriname's long term crude oi.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

Simon Longfield, CFO

Terence Alexander, Chief Operating Officer

Jon Ewing, Chief Technology Officer & Chief Marketing Officer

Diane Milliard, Global Head of HR and Recruitment

Gregory Roth, Global Head-Communications

Lyndsey Anderson, Global Head-Research

urn:contentItem:60F5-R151-JB4F-Y19V-00000-00July 23, 2020: BPM Expands in SoCal: Announces Strategic Combination with WMM CPAs2020-07-25T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 23, 2020: BPM Expands in SoCal: Announces Strategic Combination with WMM CPAs

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, announces its expansion in Orange County by combining with Irvine-based Warnick, Maestas & Maroney (WMM), An Accountancy Corporation effective August 1, 2020.

Led by partners Robert Warnick, Ronald Maestas and Martin Maroney, the WMM team offers a wide range of services to individual and business clients, including tax consulting and compliance services, estate and succession planning, financial statement services, mergers and acquisitions assistance and other high quality professional accounting services.

"We could not be happier to join a firm that prioritizes clients' needs and simultaneously emphasizes the growth and development of its people," said Maestas. "These are the same key principles we have followed since our firm's inception."

This is BPM's second business combination in the Orange County market, strengthening the Firm's footprint in Southern California.

"This combination represents a perfect fit for BPM," added David Jorgenson, Partner-in-Charge of BPM's current Orange County Office. "The blend of expertise across both firms will further expand our capabilities and deliver maximum impact on our clients' success." Jorgenson joined BPM under Kramer & Olsen when the two firms combined in 2018.

BPM's new Chief Operating Officer, Scharrell Jackson, who joined the Firm in March reinforces the Firm's commitment to a geographic footprint in Southern California. A prominent Orange County business professional, Jackson has more than 35 years of operations, accounting and finance experience in a variety of industries. Her tenure in business growth and scalability in the accounting profession continues to drive BPM's expansion in California and across the West Coast.

"We are excited to bolster our brand within the Orange County market with such an amazing group of professionals who are committed to our vision and goals," said Jackson. "In the thriving Southern California region, our ability to expand our capabilities is a decided benefit to both our clients and colleagues."

Recently ranked by Forbes as one of America's Best Tax and Accounting Firms, BPM continually strengthens its professional and client service teams with talented individuals who bring deep expertise to the table.

"Our strategic plan is focused on expanding our presence in target markets and geographies from Seattle to San Diego," added BPM CEO Jim Wallace. "Our growth in Orange County coupled with Scharrell's excellent forward-thinking mindset allows us to bring this vision to life. It has been a challenging year for our clients and colleagues - we are thrilled about this expansion and are excited for the opportunities that lie ahead in the coming months, as we continue to focus on our colleagues, clients and communities."

July 24: Burr Pilger Mayer: Julie West Named to Silicon Valley Business Journal's "40 Under 40" List

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, announced  that Julie West, Partner and Chair of the Firm's Corporate Tax Practice and Co-Chair of its Life Sciences industry group, has been selected as one of the Silicon Valley Business Journal's 2020 "40 Under 40," which recognizes young stars in Silicon Valley impacting their industries and communities.

As one of the youngest CPAs to make partner at BPM, West has more than 15 years of public accounting experience, working with clients in the biotech, pharmaceutical, medical device, software, social media, communications and manufacturing industries. She deals extensively with tax provisions, Section 382 studies to determine limitations on tax attributes, and sales tax exposure, as well as advising companies involved in a wide range of transactions, including mergers, asset and stock acquisitions and foreign expansion.

"Being a part of this exclusive list is extremely humbling," said West. "I take pride in my work, and this is a reminder of what you can achieve through hard work and by seizing every opportunity, such as leaning into practice leadership. BPM has given me the platform to learn from some amazing people and expand my capabilities as a client advisor, business leader and mentor to younger females in the profession."

Since West became Chair of the Corporate Tax Practice in 2017, it has grown by 12% year over year and continues to attract top talent.

June 17: Burr Pilger Mayer: Alissia Pope Named to North Bay "Women in Business" List

SANTA ROSA, CA, June 17, 2020 - BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, announced  that Alissia Pope, Director of Tax, has been selected as one of the North Bay Business Journal's 2020 "Women in Business," which recognizes 17 of the most outstanding female leaders, innovators and visionaries in the North Bay.

With nearly 20 years of experience providing comprehensive financial and business counsel to privately-held companies in the North Bay and beyond, Alissia works with an array of clients - some of which have been with her for her entire career. She has established herself as a perennial tax specialist who takes pride in exceptional client service and the trust she inspires in her clients.

"Whether it is day-to-day tax consulting and planning work or attending networking events throughout the year, I have always found it important to entrench myself in the industry ecosystems in which my clients operate," she said. "Understanding their pain points and the industry-specific issues they face allows me to be a better advisor to them. Being recognized for my efforts at work and in the North Bay community is extremely gratifying. As I look at the other incredible female professionals on this list, I am proud North Bay businesses are in such good hands."

Alissia is also at the forefront of recruiting new professionals to BPM and serves as a career coach for new hires in the North Bay office.

March 02: BPM Ranks as Largest Non-Big 4 Accounting Firm in the Greater Bay Area

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, was again ranked the largest non-Big Four firm in the Greater Bay Area, as it continues to serve a growing number of emerging businesses on the West Coast. Most recently, BPM was also named as one of America's Top Recommended Tax and Accounting Firms by Forbes Magazine.

As the largest non-Big Four firm in the area, BPM offers the same quality of work and full-service capabilities as the biggest firms in the country, but can do so with a more personal approach and higher standard of customer service.

The San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal released the rankings based on number of Bay Area client service professionals in Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Monterey, Napa, San Benito, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Santa Cruz, Solano and Sonoma counties. This is the second year BPM ranked as a Top Five firm. In addition, the publications ranked the Firm as the second largest firm in the East Bay.

Over the past year, BPM grew organically and strategically and added 73 professionals in just the Bay Area along the way. The Firm also introduced new specialty services, including Managed IT Services and IT Security Advisory, and offices in Fairfield, Calif.

February 05: Burr Pilger Mayer: OMB Releases Proposed Uniform Guidance Changes

The Office of Management and Budget (OMB) has released their proposed changes to the Uniform Guidance requirements. Nonfederal entities can comment on the proposed changes through March 23, 2020 at regulations.gov.

Among the proposed changes are -

Procurement Revisions

The proposed guidance removes specific threshold dollar amounts from the Uniform Guidance and aligns it with the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), the 2017 and 2018 National Defense Acquisition Authorization Acts (NDAA), and the OMB Memorandum M-18-18. If these changes are accepted, the micro-purchase threshold would increase to $10,000 (from $3,500) and the simplified acquisition threshold would increase to $250,000 (from $150,000) for all nonfederal entities. The definition of micro-purchase also includes the purchase of supplies or services for which the aggregate amount does not exceed the micro-purchase threshold.

Governmentwide Approach to Performance and Risk

This section focuses on the Results-Orientated Accountability for Grants Cross-Agency Priority Goal (Grants CAP goal) that shifts the balance between compliance and performance while reducing burden. It encourages Federal agencies to work together to develop a risk-based approach that incorporates performance to achieve results-oriented grants.

February 04: BPM Offers Clients Wider Variety of Specialty Services in 2020

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, has been recognized by ClearlyRated as a "Best of Accounting Diamond Award" winner for providing superior service to its clients for five consecutive years. Just 25% of the 2020 Best of Accounting winners earned the Diamond Award distinction, which cements the Firm's commitment to its clients' business needs and goals-both through its growth of strategic services offered and expansion into new geographic regions.

"Being recognized for the fifth consecutive year and obtaining the 'Diamond' distinction for our exceptional client service is truly an honor," said Jim Wallace, CEO of BPM. "This is a testament to our professionals who are continually striving to empower our clients with the knowledge and support they need to succeed through our industry focus and specialized services."

The "Best of Accounting Award" winners are selected solely on the industry-leading satisfaction scores received from clients. BPM received satisfaction scores of 9 or 10 out of 10 from 81.4% of its clients, which is significantly higher than the industry's average of 45% in 2019. The Firm also received a Net Promoter Score of 78.4%, whereas the industry average was 24% in 2019.

"The feedback we receive from our clients directly impact our decisions and are incorporated into our operating strategy each year," added Jessica Hekmatjah, Director of Marketing and Corporate Development at BPM.

February 03: Burr Pilger Mayer: Including Financial Wellness in Your Retirement Plan Strategy

Many employees are paying a high price for their inadvertent ignorance about personal finance matters, studies are concluding. The price isn't measured solely in bad investment or spending decisions, but also emotional and physical health, as well as in diminished job productivity. Employees' understanding of your retirement plan, or lack thereof, is a critical piece of the puzzle. Designing a retirement plan educational strategy without considering employees' financial wellness could yield disappointing results.

Connect Literacy to Health

A study by the Stanford Center on Longevity found that Americans are losing ground in three "interdependent domains": healthy living, financial security and social engagement. As a result, the study found, "many companies are expanding their vision of wellness to include other aspects of an employee's wellbeing," including personal finance. And a report by Prudential found that increasing "numbers of employers are finding it advantageous to address overall wellness - financial and physical and social engagement - in their human capital strategy."

For some, it begins with a crash course in financial literacy. A recent study of Americans' grasps of basic personal finance topics conducted by the TIAA Institute identified "critical gaps in financial literacy among American adults and underscored the connection between financial literacy and financial health." The average survey respondent could answer only around half of the questions in a quiz that was administered as part of the study.

February 03: Burr Pilger Mayer: IRS Clarifies Meaning of Plan "Contribution" for Tax Deduction Purposes

When is an employer contribution to a retirement plan truly a contribution eligible for a tax deduction under ERISA Section 404(a)? Although this might seem like a rhetorical question, it was deemed worthy enough to warrant a ruling by the U.S. Supreme Court. The IRS also addressed the matter in a chief counsel memorandum (CCM). The issue can arise when a plan sponsor does something more complicated than simply transfer corporate funds from its own bank account to that of the retirement plan trust in a straightforward manner.

January 31: Burr Pilger Mayer: Webinar: Digital Assets and Blockchain Tax Reporting Challenges

BPM Partner Dmitri Alexeev will discuss non-income tax reporting challenges for digital assets and blockchain companies during an Accounting Blockchain Coalition (ABC) webinar starting at 9 a.m. PT on Friday, January 31.

Dmitri co-leads BPM's Blockchain and Digital Assets group, which helps emerging and mid-market technology and consumer companies, among others, within the blockchain technology space.

He is also the Chair of the ABC's Taxation Working Group, which reviews, discusses, documents and shares existing industry best practices for operational process improvement and the tax treatment of digital assets including the impact of token classifications, gains and income from sales/forks/mining, token exchange implications, inventory and valuation methods, tax filings and jurisdictional variances to get started.

The Accounting Blockchain Coalition is an industry association formed to educate businesses and organizations on accounting matters relevant to digital assets and distributed ledger technology, including blockchain. Members include professionals from the accounting, law, tax, technology and higher education fields.

January 28: Burr Pilger Mayer: Protect Your Exempt Status in Election 2020

Nonprofits that are tax-exempt as 501(c)(3) organizations, including charities and churches, are barred from participating or intervening in any political campaign for or against a candidate for public office. Organizations that violate the prohibition risk losing their tax-exempt status. They also could find themselves on the hook for an excise tax. Here's what you need to know to keep your nonprofit on the right side of the political activities law.

What are the rules?

According to the IRS, an organization intervenes in a political campaign if it:

Makes or solicits contributions to or for candidates or political organizations, Endorses a candidate or rates candidates, Distributes partisan campaign literature or written statements, Has its representatives speak out about a candidate, or Uses its resources to influence an election. Your nonprofit can, however, conduct nonpartisan activities that educate the public and help them participate in the election process.

What's OK, what isn't?

Some politics-related activities or expenses may be permissible depending on the facts and circumstances. For example:

Voter education. Voter education activities, such as publishing voter education guides, don't constitute prohibited activity if conducted in a nonpartisan manner.

January 28: Burr Pilger Mayer: Collective Impact Initiatives Rely on Harmony

Collective impact, an approach that's growing among nonprofits, is more than just collaboration. Its originators describe the phrase as the commitment of a group of important players from different sectors to a common agenda for solving a specific social problem. That includes the nonprofits themselves, government, businesses and constituent communities.

In the Stanford Social Innovation Review article that introduced the concept, the authors explicitly contrasted collective impact with collaboration. Unlike most collaborations, they explained, collective impact initiatives involve a centralized infrastructure, dedicated staff and structured process.

Create the right environment

An example of the approach: In 2016, the Hampton Roads Community Foundation in Southeast Virginia initiated a regionwide process to improve the results in early care and education programs. It tapped almost 100 stakeholders in planning a program designed to unite previously disparate programs and participants to achieve greater impact. The Minus 9 to 5 initiative has been able to align actions across five cities in Virginia in only two years.

Adherents of collective impact typically cite five prerequisites that together produce the alignment necessary for successful initiatives:

First, a common agenda is paramount.

January 28: Burr Pilger Mayer: Writing Donation Acknowledgement Letters

Sending thank-yous to your donors doesn't just make sense in terms of building and maintaining relationships. The IRS mandates that taxpayers substantiate single contributions of $250 or more with contemporaneous written acknowledgments. Here's what you should include in those acknowledgments.

The essentials

A written contribution acknowledgment should contain:

The name of your organization, The amount of the contribution, The date of the contribution, A description (but not the value) of noncash contributions, When appropriate, a statement that no goods or services were provided by your nonprofit, When appropriate, a description and good-faith estimate of the value of any goods or services provided in exchange for the contribution, and When appropriate, a statement that any goods or services provided consisted entirely of intangible religious benefits. Some state tax authorities also require a tax-exempt status statement with your organization's Employer Identification Number.

The IRS leaves it up to nonprofits to decide on the appropriate medium for donation acknowledgments. For example, it could be a letter, postcard, email or text.

Timing matters

According to the IRS, acknowledgments are "contemporaneous" when donors receive them by the earlier of 1) the date they actually file their income tax returns for the year of the contribution or 2) the due date of the return.

January 27: Burr Pilger Mayer: Trustees and Beneficiaries Can Save Taxes with the "65-Day Rule"

Executors of estates and trustees of complex trusts may have an opportunity to reduce 2019 income taxes. Trusts and estates begin paying taxes at the top federal rate of 37.0% when 2019 taxable income exceeds $12,750. In addition, interest, dividend, net capital gains, and other investment income is subject to the 3.8% net investment income tax, resulting in a total federal marginal tax rate of up to 40.8%. Personal federal taxes for 2019 do not reach the top tax bracket of 37.0% until taxable income exceeds $510,300 for single filers or $612,350 for married, joint filers. Individuals are also subject to the 3.8% tax on net investment income at $200,000 - $250,000 of modified adjusted gross income.

The TCJA of 2017 suspension of federal investment expense and other miscellaneous deductions may increase the trust's 2019 income. The TCJA has also created a federal Qualified Business Income deduction (Section 199A). When Section 199A is applicable and trust distributions are made, the deduction is allocable between the trust and its beneficiaries.

Income distributions made by the estate or trust to beneficiaries in a lower tax bracket during the tax year may result in overall tax savings.

January 14: Burr Pilger Mayer: 5 Blockchain, Digital Assets and Crypto Trends to Expect in 2020

Blockchain technology is already transforming how we treat information, value and commerce, and it may very well lead to the next Internet. But what cryptocurrency trends can digital asset entrepreneurs and users expect in 2020?

A public blockchain, readers will recall, has no owners and no centralized databases. This revolutionary technology has unsurprisingly inspired thought leaders to dream up a wide range of potential applications, from financial services to real estate to voting.

But while the technology can bring new efficiencies and other benefits to commerce, it also brings with it a number of challenges, such as privacy and security. Currently, digital assets are the most widely used application of blockchain technology. With the new year already well under way, BPM sees notable trends that are influencing the blockchain and cryptocurrency spaces - and that will only increase in importance as 2020 runs its course.

Source: Company Website

January 14: BPM's Mark Li Discusses the Future of Crypto in Legaltech News

Sometimes, there are things that you just can't predict. For all of the talk about artificial intelligence, maybe it's blockchain tech, or analytics capabilities, or other types of automation that emerge as the big tech trend of 2020. Maybe the big tech trend won't be an actual technology at all, but rather new education methods and ways to apply pre-existing technology that today's law firms and corporate legal departments have never even dreamed about.

Today's set of predictions, the final one of our series to begin 2020, is about those new ideas. It's where lawyers and technologists let their minds run free, talking about those trends that are just beginning to take shape and may explode in the coming year. And whether it's new areas of litigation like cryptocurrency or simply breaking down silos, there's a lot to look forward to in the coming year.

This is the final of  a six-part series of 2020 predictions from Legaltech News.  Last week, we ran experts' predictions for  e-discovery,  the CCPA,  privacy  and  cybersecurity  in 2020. Yesterday, we focused on predictions for  artificial intelligence. The quotes below are in alphabetical order by name, and some have been edited for length.

Stephen Allen, head of innovation and digital, Hogan Lovells: "In 2019, many law firms and legal departments were building out their legal tech capabilities in areas such as automated contract review, automated document creation, and matter management and budgeting tools.

January 14: Burr Pilger Mayer: Service Highlight: Executive Search

Finding a new finance executive to help drive your company's future success is no easy feat, especially when you've experienced an unexpected departure of the previous executive or you're in the midst of a transaction, high growth or other revolutionary change. Not only is it imperative that you find a candidate who is deeply skilled in finance and knowledgeable of your company's industry, but you also must have someone who is a great cultural fit.

Our search team has unparalleled access to excellent candidates by drawing upon our trusted network of over 500 employees, large alumni group, vast footprint of clients and contacts, and our extensive network of business partners.

From agribusiness companies in the Central Valley and wine producers in the North Bay to high-tech companies in Silicon Valley and service and manufacturing companies in the East Bay- BPM's Executive Search team works with company founders and leaders to recruit a CFO or other finance executive who will drive future financial success.

Our Executive Search team understands that boards and CEOs need progressive and proactive business advisors. Unlike other search providers, we are embedded in one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, which gives us unique visibility into what it takes to be a strong financial leader.

urn:contentItem:60DY-SDM1-JB4F-Y244-00000-00July 23, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Funding Will Create Commercial Opportunities For Medical Devices In The Philippines2020-07-24T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 23, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Funding Will Create Commercial Opportunities For Medical Devices In The Philippines

Despite an expected economic recession in the Philippines in 2020, which will pose headwinds to the medical device market, commercial opportunities are still on the rise. Funding from the Philippines Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO), as well as the Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corporation (PAGCOR), will provide opportunities for medical device manufacturers and suppliers.

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

July 23: Business Monitor International Inc.: Netherlands 5G Spectrum Auction: High Prices For Small Market

The Netherlands has completed its initial 5G spectrum auction, raising EUR1.23bn. Bids were relatively high, reflecting the three incumbents' robust IoT pedigrees. The risk is that they may have overpaid in an effort to secure access to a small industrial IoT market.

T-Mobile appears to have come off worst in the auction, securing 70MHz.

Source: Company Website

July 23: Business Monitor International Inc.: Off-Trade Coffee Spending Boosted By Covid-19 Pandemic

At Fitch Solutions, we believe that consumer spending on coffee (through retail channels) will receive a significant boost in 2020 due to the Covid-19 pandemic. We project consumer spending on coffee globally to increase by 5.8% y-o-y (in US dollar terms) in 2020, which is significantly up from the estimated growth of 0.1% y-o-y in 2019 and the average annual growth rate of 1.0% over 2.

Source: Company Website

July 22: Business Monitor International Inc.: Pent-Up Investor Demand Paving Way For Smaller Brazilian Floats

Despite being home to one of the world's largest stock exchanges, Brazil has struggled to record a strong flow of IPO activity over recent years. We believe that deal levels on the Sao Paulo Stock Exchange (or commonly known as the Bovespa bourse) will also remain low in the near term, with the country expected to see a forecast sharp contraction in economic growth in 2020. At Fitch Solutions, we forecast the Brazilian econ.

Source: Company Website

July 22: Business Monitor International Inc.: Japanese Subsidies Will Further Benefit South East Asia's Ability To Attract Autos Investment

Japan's push to reduce its industries' reliance on Chinese manufacturing by subsidising the relocation of manufacturing facilities out of China and not only back to Japan, but also into the wider South East Asia region, will greatly benefit countries in South East Asia. One of the key themes that emerged from this first round of incentives is that the manufacturing of steel c.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: What Our Clients Want To Know: Commodities After Covid-19

On June 30, Fitch Solutions held a webinar, 'Commodities After-Covid-19: Trends And Opportunities', in which we discussed the short-term impact of the pandemic on commodities prices and long-term implications for the agribusiness and mining & metals sectors. In this article, we answer some of the most asked questions received during the webinar's Q&A session.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: USMCA Gives Mexico Advantage As Global Supply Chains Shift

The effectuation of the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) will compound the existing factors supporting Mexico as a beneficiary of automotive supply chain diversification. Mexico's comparatively attractive operating environment and proximity to the US and Canada inform our assessment that it will benefit from a reallocation of automotive production resources after the Covid-.

Source: Company Website

July 16: Business Monitor International Inc.: Argentina's Vehicle Production Faces Unprecedented Threat From Covid-19

The Covid-19 pandemic poses an unprecedented threat to Argentina's vehicle output as it causes disruption to production while also dampening the demand for new vehicles. The weak economic outlook will provide little support for Argentina's vehicle production industry as it will severely dampen the demand for new vehicles. In 2020, we expect Argentina's vehicle sales.

Source: Company Website

July 16: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spain To Impose Targeted Regional Lockdown As New Confirmed Covid-19 Cases Doubled

Targeted regional lockdown in Spain as new infection doubled post nationwide lockdown. ROVI's facility in Madrid to manufacture Moderna's Covid-19 vaccine candidate. 95% of Spain's population remains susceptible to Covid-19 virus.

Source: Company Website

July 15: Business Monitor International Inc.: Asia Autos Production: Japan Regains Second Place, But Is Not Without Challenges

In the most recent update of our Autos Production RRI, the Asia region's overall score has remained stable at 56.2 out of a possible 100. As such, the region maintains its position as the most attractive region for vehicle production globally, followed by Europe (53.8) and the Americas (43.4). The Asia region benefits from major automotive countries, such as China, Japan and India, all having large volume vehicle production, healthy completion, a good pool of skilled labour and strong automotive policies. However, production growth scores in these markets have fallen due to the spread of Covid-19. We highlight that Japan is not shielded from suppressed output amid the pandemic, which means that its overall score is being held back by its performance under our 'Vehicle production growth' indicator on our Risk/Reward Index.

July 14: Business Monitor International Inc.: Weak Economic Outlook Will Weigh On The Pharmaceutical Sector In The Maldives

Pharmaceutical market growth in the Maldives will remain on a low-growth trajectory due to restrictions in healthcare funds, as a result of ongoing economic weakness. The country's pharmaceutical imports will increase in line with government's commitment to improve health services. The majority of medicines will continue to be sourced from South Asian and European d.

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahrain Will Be Among Most Resilient GCC Autos Markets In 2020

Bahrain will suffer from a 'double whammy' of external shocks in the near term in the form of sharply lower oil prices and the spread of Covid-19, which will be damaging for both business and consumer spending on vehicles. Local business appetite for spending in areas such as fleet renewal will be highly limited over the coming period, as the domestic economy slows dramatical.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Brazilian Regulatory Authority Continues To Approve Covid-19 Vaccine Trials

The Brazilian National Regulatory Agency continues to approve vaccine trials in the country to tackle the Covid-19 pandemic. Further partnerships between Brazil and international vaccine developers likely to take place in H220 due to the country's high daily case count. Discordant government response continues to be detrimental to Brazil's Covid-19 reaction.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Japan Diversifies LNG Sources With Mozambique Investment

Japan has pledged support for the Area 1 Mozambique LNG project supporting the outlook for Mozambique LNG although significant delays to LNG projects in Mozambique appear inevitable as market conditions deteriorate. LNG from Mozambique would further expand Japan's current pool of LNG suppliers as it seeks further diversification of its import sources. Japan's LNG de.

Source: Company Website

July 09: Business Monitor International Inc.: Tanzania Continues To Shut Covid-19 Centres As No New Cases Reported For Two Months

Tanzania continues to shut down Covid-19 facilities as official numbers show a sharp decline in cases. Low healthcare spending per capita in Tanzania means healthcare facilities need to be used efficiently. Doubts about official Covid-19 figures remain. Tanzania continues to shut down Covid-19 facilities as official numbers show a sharp decline.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

Simon Longfield, CFO

Terence Alexander, Chief Operating Officer

Jon Ewing, Chief Technology Officer & Chief Marketing Officer

Diane Milliard, Global Head of HR and Recruitment

Gregory Roth, Global Head-Communications

Lyndsey Anderson, Global Head-Research

More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

urn:contentItem:60DY-SDM1-JB4F-Y246-00000-00July 23, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Off-Trade Coffee Spending Boosted By Covid-19 Pandemic2020-07-24T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 23, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Off-Trade Coffee Spending Boosted By Covid-19 Pandemic

At Fitch Solutions, we believe that consumer spending on coffee (through retail channels) will receive a significant boost in 2020 due to the Covid-19 pandemic. We project consumer spending on coffee globally to increase by 5.8% y-o-y (in US dollar terms) in 2020, which is significantly up from the estimated growth of 0.1% y-o-y in 2019 and the average annual growth rate of 1.0% over 2.

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

Business Monitor International Inc.

Key Stats

Estimated Revenue (TTM): $1 Million

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

2.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4296431365

Website: http://www.businessmonitor.com

Industry: Software and Technology Servic

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. The government's healthcare budget will come under pressure in the near term, as the Bahamas recovers from Hurricane Dorian and the Covid-19 impact. The Bahamas could increasingly attract investment from active pharmaceutical ingr.

Source: Company Website

May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

July 23: Business Monitor International Inc.: Netherlands 5G Spectrum Auction: High Prices For Small Market

The Netherlands has completed its initial 5G spectrum auction, raising EUR1.23bn. Bids were relatively high, reflecting the three incumbents' robust IoT pedigrees. The risk is that they may have overpaid in an effort to secure access to a small industrial IoT market.

T-Mobile appears to have come off worst in the auction, securing 70MHz.

Source: Company Website

July 23: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Funding Will Create Commercial Opportunities For Medical Devices In The Philippines

Despite an expected economic recession in the Philippines in 2020, which will pose headwinds to the medical device market, commercial opportunities are still on the rise. Funding from the Philippines Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO), as well as the Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corporation (PAGCOR), will provide opportunities for medical device manufacturers and suppliers.

Source: Company Website

July 22: Business Monitor International Inc.: Pent-Up Investor Demand Paving Way For Smaller Brazilian Floats

Despite being home to one of the world's largest stock exchanges, Brazil has struggled to record a strong flow of IPO activity over recent years. We believe that deal levels on the Sao Paulo Stock Exchange (or commonly known as the Bovespa bourse) will also remain low in the near term, with the country expected to see a forecast sharp contraction in economic growth in 2020. At Fitch Solutions, we forecast the Brazilian econ.

Source: Company Website

July 22: Business Monitor International Inc.: Japanese Subsidies Will Further Benefit South East Asia's Ability To Attract Autos Investment

Japan's push to reduce its industries' reliance on Chinese manufacturing by subsidising the relocation of manufacturing facilities out of China and not only back to Japan, but also into the wider South East Asia region, will greatly benefit countries in South East Asia. One of the key themes that emerged from this first round of incentives is that the manufacturing of steel c.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: What Our Clients Want To Know: Commodities After Covid-19

On June 30, Fitch Solutions held a webinar, 'Commodities After-Covid-19: Trends And Opportunities', in which we discussed the short-term impact of the pandemic on commodities prices and long-term implications for the agribusiness and mining & metals sectors. In this article, we answer some of the most asked questions received during the webinar's Q&A session.

Source: Company Website

July 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: USMCA Gives Mexico Advantage As Global Supply Chains Shift

The effectuation of the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) will compound the existing factors supporting Mexico as a beneficiary of automotive supply chain diversification. Mexico's comparatively attractive operating environment and proximity to the US and Canada inform our assessment that it will benefit from a reallocation of automotive production resources after the Covid-.

Source: Company Website

July 16: Business Monitor International Inc.: Argentina's Vehicle Production Faces Unprecedented Threat From Covid-19

The Covid-19 pandemic poses an unprecedented threat to Argentina's vehicle output as it causes disruption to production while also dampening the demand for new vehicles. The weak economic outlook will provide little support for Argentina's vehicle production industry as it will severely dampen the demand for new vehicles. In 2020, we expect Argentina's vehicle sales.

Source: Company Website

July 16: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spain To Impose Targeted Regional Lockdown As New Confirmed Covid-19 Cases Doubled

Targeted regional lockdown in Spain as new infection doubled post nationwide lockdown. ROVI's facility in Madrid to manufacture Moderna's Covid-19 vaccine candidate. 95% of Spain's population remains susceptible to Covid-19 virus.

Source: Company Website

July 15: Business Monitor International Inc.: Asia Autos Production: Japan Regains Second Place, But Is Not Without Challenges

In the most recent update of our Autos Production RRI, the Asia region's overall score has remained stable at 56.2 out of a possible 100. As such, the region maintains its position as the most attractive region for vehicle production globally, followed by Europe (53.8) and the Americas (43.4). The Asia region benefits from major automotive countries, such as China, Japan and India, all having large volume vehicle production, healthy completion, a good pool of skilled labour and strong automotive policies. However, production growth scores in these markets have fallen due to the spread of Covid-19. We highlight that Japan is not shielded from suppressed output amid the pandemic, which means that its overall score is being held back by its performance under our 'Vehicle production growth' indicator on our Risk/Reward Index.

Strength Of China's Autos Industry Keeps It On Top Asia - Autos Production Risk/Reward Index Heat Map

In the most recent update of our Autos Production Risk/Reward Index (RRI), the Asia region's overall score has remained stable at 56.2 out of a possible 100.

July 14: Business Monitor International Inc.: Weak Economic Outlook Will Weigh On The Pharmaceutical Sector In The Maldives

Pharmaceutical market growth in the Maldives will remain on a low-growth trajectory due to restrictions in healthcare funds, as a result of ongoing economic weakness. The country's pharmaceutical imports will increase in line with government's commitment to improve health services. The majority of medicines will continue to be sourced from South Asian and European d.

Source: Company Website

July 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Generic Drugmakers Will See Increasing Opportunities In Mexico

This report from Fitch Solutions Country Risk & Industry Research is a product of Fitch Solutions Group Ltd, UK Company registration number 08789939 ('FSG'). FSG is an affiliate of Fitch Ratings Inc.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahrain Will Be Among Most Resilient GCC Autos Markets In 2020

Bahrain will suffer from a 'double whammy' of external shocks in the near term in the form of sharply lower oil prices and the spread of Covid-19, which will be damaging for both business and consumer spending on vehicles. Local business appetite for spending in areas such as fleet renewal will be highly limited over the coming period, as the domestic economy slows dramatical.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Brazilian Regulatory Authority Continues To Approve Covid-19 Vaccine Trials

The Brazilian National Regulatory Agency continues to approve vaccine trials in the country to tackle the Covid-19 pandemic. Further partnerships between Brazil and international vaccine developers likely to take place in H220 due to the country's high daily case count. Discordant government response continues to be detrimental to Brazil's Covid-19 reaction.

Source: Company Website

July 10: Business Monitor International Inc.: Japan Diversifies LNG Sources With Mozambique Investment

Japan has pledged support for the Area 1 Mozambique LNG project supporting the outlook for Mozambique LNG although significant delays to LNG projects in Mozambique appear inevitable as market conditions deteriorate. LNG from Mozambique would further expand Japan's current pool of LNG suppliers as it seeks further diversification of its import sources. Japan's LNG de.

Source: Company Website

July 09: Business Monitor International Inc.: Tanzania Continues To Shut Covid-19 Centres As No New Cases Reported For Two Months

Tanzania continues to shut down Covid-19 facilities as official numbers show a sharp decline in cases. Low healthcare spending per capita in Tanzania means healthcare facilities need to be used efficiently. Doubts about official Covid-19 figures remain. Tanzania continues to shut down Covid-19 facilities as official numbers show a sharp decline.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

urn:contentItem:60F5-R151-JB4F-Y19X-00000-00July 24, 2020: Burr Pilger Mayer: Julie West Named to Silicon Valley Business Journal's "40 Under 40" List2020-07-25T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T22:05:50ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSJuly 24, 2020: Burr Pilger Mayer: Julie West Named to Silicon Valley Business Journal's "40 Under 40" List

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, announced that Julie West, Partner and Chair of the Firm's Corporate Tax Practice and Co-Chair of its Life Sciences industry group, has been selected as one of the Silicon Valley Business Journal's 2020 "40 Under 40," which recognizes young stars in Silicon Valley impacting their industries and communities.

As one of the youngest CPAs to make partner at BPM, West has more than 15 years of public accounting experience, working with clients in the biotech, pharmaceutical, medical device, software, social media, communications and manufacturing industries. She deals extensively with tax provisions, Section 382 studies to determine limitations on tax attributes, and sales tax exposure, as well as advising companies involved in a wide range of transactions, including mergers, asset and stock acquisitions and foreign expansion.

"Being a part of this exclusive list is extremely humbling," said West. "I take pride in my work, and this is a reminder of what you can achieve through hard work and by seizing every opportunity, such as leaning into practice leadership. BPM has given me the platform to learn from some amazing people and expand my capabilities as a client advisor, business leader and mentor to younger females in the profession."

Since West became Chair of the Corporate Tax Practice in 2017, it has grown by 12% year over year and continues to attract top talent. In her Life Science industry group role, West leads the development and organization of educational panels, roundtables and monthly meetings aimed at expanding the group and driving business development. She is also a member of the Firm's Inclusion Now! (IN) Committee, which focuses on ensuring a firm culture that enhances the retention, recruitment and professional development of women, minorities, LGBTQIA+ and non-binary team members.

"Julie is the quintessential role model for young women interested in pursuing careers in accounting and finance, proving one can have both a rewarding career while also taking time for family," said Tom Garigliano, BPM Tax Chair and Board member. "She is an integral part of shaping the strategy and vision for the Firm, and her mentorship of up-and-coming professionals is second to none. From chairing our Corporate Tax Practice and Life Science industry group to juggling her extensive client work and volunteering at her daughter's school and in the community, Julie's recognition is greatly deserved."

The Silicon Valley Business Journal will recognize West and the other 2020 "40 Under 40" honorees via a virtual webinar celebration on August 13.

July 23: BPM Expands in SoCal: Announces Strategic Combination with WMM CPAs

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, announces its expansion in Orange County by combining with Irvine-based Warnick, Maestas & Maroney (WMM), An Accountancy Corporation effective August 1, 2020.

Led by partners Robert Warnick, Ronald Maestas and Martin Maroney, the WMM team offers a wide range of services to individual and business clients, including tax consulting and compliance services, estate and succession planning, financial statement services, mergers and acquisitions assistance and other high quality professional accounting services.

"We could not be happier to join a firm that prioritizes clients' needs and simultaneously emphasizes the growth and development of its people," said Maestas. "These are the same key principles we have followed since our firm's inception."

This is BPM's second business combination in the Orange County market, strengthening the Firm's footprint in Southern California.

"This combination represents a perfect fit for BPM," added David Jorgenson, Partner-in-Charge of BPM's current Orange County Office. "The blend of expertise across both firms will further expand our capabilities and deliver maximum impact on our clients' success." Jorgenson joined BPM under Kramer & Olsen when the two firms combined in 2018.

BPM's new Chief Operating Officer, Scharrell Jackson, who joined the Firm in March reinforces the Firm's commitment to a geographic footprint in Southern California.

June 17: Burr Pilger Mayer: Alissia Pope Named to North Bay "Women in Business" List

SANTA ROSA, CA, June 17, 2020 - BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, announced  that Alissia Pope, Director of Tax, has been selected as one of the North Bay Business Journal's 2020 "Women in Business," which recognizes 17 of the most outstanding female leaders, innovators and visionaries in the North Bay.

With nearly 20 years of experience providing comprehensive financial and business counsel to privately-held companies in the North Bay and beyond, Alissia works with an array of clients - some of which have been with her for her entire career. She has established herself as a perennial tax specialist who takes pride in exceptional client service and the trust she inspires in her clients.

"Whether it is day-to-day tax consulting and planning work or attending networking events throughout the year, I have always found it important to entrench myself in the industry ecosystems in which my clients operate," she said. "Understanding their pain points and the industry-specific issues they face allows me to be a better advisor to them. Being recognized for my efforts at work and in the North Bay community is extremely gratifying. As I look at the other incredible female professionals on this list, I am proud North Bay businesses are in such good hands."

Alissia is also at the forefront of recruiting new professionals to BPM and serves as a career coach for new hires in the North Bay office.

March 02: BPM Ranks as Largest Non-Big 4 Accounting Firm in the Greater Bay Area

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, was again ranked the largest non-Big Four firm in the Greater Bay Area, as it continues to serve a growing number of emerging businesses on the West Coast. Most recently, BPM was also named as one of America's Top Recommended Tax and Accounting Firms by Forbes Magazine.

As the largest non-Big Four firm in the area, BPM offers the same quality of work and full-service capabilities as the biggest firms in the country, but can do so with a more personal approach and higher standard of customer service.

The San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal released the rankings based on number of Bay Area client service professionals in Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Monterey, Napa, San Benito, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Santa Cruz, Solano and Sonoma counties. This is the second year BPM ranked as a Top Five firm. In addition, the publications ranked the Firm as the second largest firm in the East Bay.

Over the past year, BPM grew organically and strategically and added 73 professionals in just the Bay Area along the way. The Firm also introduced new specialty services, including Managed IT Services and IT Security Advisory, and offices in Fairfield, Calif.

February 05: Burr Pilger Mayer: OMB Releases Proposed Uniform Guidance Changes

The Office of Management and Budget (OMB) has released their proposed changes to the Uniform Guidance requirements. Nonfederal entities can comment on the proposed changes through March 23, 2020 at regulations.gov.

Among the proposed changes are -

Procurement Revisions

The proposed guidance removes specific threshold dollar amounts from the Uniform Guidance and aligns it with the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), the 2017 and 2018 National Defense Acquisition Authorization Acts (NDAA), and the OMB Memorandum M-18-18. If these changes are accepted, the micro-purchase threshold would increase to $10,000 (from $3,500) and the simplified acquisition threshold would increase to $250,000 (from $150,000) for all nonfederal entities. The definition of micro-purchase also includes the purchase of supplies or services for which the aggregate amount does not exceed the micro-purchase threshold.

Governmentwide Approach to Performance and Risk

This section focuses on the Results-Orientated Accountability for Grants Cross-Agency Priority Goal (Grants CAP goal) that shifts the balance between compliance and performance while reducing burden. It encourages Federal agencies to work together to develop a risk-based approach that incorporates performance to achieve results-oriented grants.

February 04: BPM Offers Clients Wider Variety of Specialty Services in 2020

BPM, one of the 50 largest public accounting and advisory firms in the country, has been recognized by ClearlyRated as a "Best of Accounting Diamond Award" winner for providing superior service to its clients for five consecutive years. Just 25% of the 2020 Best of Accounting winners earned the Diamond Award distinction, which cements the Firm's commitment to its clients' business needs and goals-both through its growth of strategic services offered and expansion into new geographic regions.

"Being recognized for the fifth consecutive year and obtaining the 'Diamond' distinction for our exceptional client service is truly an honor," said Jim Wallace, CEO of BPM. "This is a testament to our professionals who are continually striving to empower our clients with the knowledge and support they need to succeed through our industry focus and specialized services."

The "Best of Accounting Award" winners are selected solely on the industry-leading satisfaction scores received from clients. BPM received satisfaction scores of 9 or 10 out of 10 from 81.4% of its clients, which is significantly higher than the industry's average of 45% in 2019. The Firm also received a Net Promoter Score of 78.4%, whereas the industry average was 24% in 2019.

"The feedback we receive from our clients directly impact our decisions and are incorporated into our operating strategy each year," added Jessica Hekmatjah, Director of Marketing and Corporate Development at BPM.

February 03: Burr Pilger Mayer: Including Financial Wellness in Your Retirement Plan Strategy

Many employees are paying a high price for their inadvertent ignorance about personal finance matters, studies are concluding. The price isn't measured solely in bad investment or spending decisions, but also emotional and physical health, as well as in diminished job productivity. Employees' understanding of your retirement plan, or lack thereof, is a critical piece of the puzzle. Designing a retirement plan educational strategy without considering employees' financial wellness could yield disappointing results.

Connect Literacy to Health

A study by the Stanford Center on Longevity found that Americans are losing ground in three "interdependent domains": healthy living, financial security and social engagement. As a result, the study found, "many companies are expanding their vision of wellness to include other aspects of an employee's wellbeing," including personal finance. And a report by Prudential found that increasing "numbers of employers are finding it advantageous to address overall wellness - financial and physical and social engagement - in their human capital strategy."

For some, it begins with a crash course in financial literacy. A recent study of Americans' grasps of basic personal finance topics conducted by the TIAA Institute identified "critical gaps in financial literacy among American adults and underscored the connection between financial literacy and financial health." The average survey respondent could answer only around half of the questions in a quiz that was administered as part of the study.

February 03: Burr Pilger Mayer: IRS Clarifies Meaning of Plan "Contribution" for Tax Deduction Purposes

When is an employer contribution to a retirement plan truly a contribution eligible for a tax deduction under ERISA Section 404(a)? Although this might seem like a rhetorical question, it was deemed worthy enough to warrant a ruling by the U.S. Supreme Court. The IRS also addressed the matter in a chief counsel memorandum (CCM). The issue can arise when a plan sponsor does something more complicated than simply transfer corporate funds from its own bank account to that of the retirement plan trust in a straightforward manner.

January 31: Burr Pilger Mayer: Webinar: Digital Assets and Blockchain Tax Reporting Challenges

BPM Partner Dmitri Alexeev will discuss non-income tax reporting challenges for digital assets and blockchain companies during an Accounting Blockchain Coalition (ABC) webinar starting at 9 a.m. PT on Friday, January 31.

Dmitri co-leads BPM's Blockchain and Digital Assets group, which helps emerging and mid-market technology and consumer companies, among others, within the blockchain technology space.

He is also the Chair of the ABC's Taxation Working Group, which reviews, discusses, documents and shares existing industry best practices for operational process improvement and the tax treatment of digital assets including the impact of token classifications, gains and income from sales/forks/mining, token exchange implications, inventory and valuation methods, tax filings and jurisdictional variances to get started.

The Accounting Blockchain Coalition is an industry association formed to educate businesses and organizations on accounting matters relevant to digital assets and distributed ledger technology, including blockchain. Members include professionals from the accounting, law, tax, technology and higher education fields.
